During the year ended December 31, 2020, we received proceeds from the issuance of additional senior secured notes of $975.5 million, inclusive of issue premiums of $37.6 million and net of financing fees paid of $2.1 million, had net repayments on our ABL Credit Facility of $405.0 million, made capital lease and other financing payments of $56.7 million, made contingent purchase price payments ----- of $28.9 million, made principal payments on our existing term loan facilities of $22.2 million, made distributions to members of $12.0 million and received an equity contribution of $0.4 million. During the year ended December 31, 2019, we refinanced our debt on July 12, 2019 and received proceeds from a new first lien term loan of $2,020.0 million, new senior secured notes of $1,000.0 million and new senior unsecured notes of $1,050.0 million, repaid in full the then existing first lien term loan of $2,981.4 million, second lien term loan of $245.0 million and second lien notes of $710.0 million and paid $88.5 million of financing fees. Additionally, during the year ended December 31, 2019, we received proceeds from a new delayed draw term loan of $200.0 million, had net borrowings on our ABL Credit Facility of $405.0 million and net repayments of our revolving credit loan of $29.0 million, received equity contributions including $208.0 million due to the investment in Allied Universal by CDPQ, made capital lease and other financing payments of $47.0 million, made principal payments on our then existing term loan facilities of $15.3 million and made distributions to members of $3.6 million. Based upon our current level of operations, we believe that our existing cash balances and our cash from operating activities, together with available borrowings under our Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities, will be adequate to meet our anticipated requirements for working capital, capital expenditures, income tax payments and distributions, commitments and interest payments for the foreseeable future. There can be no assurance, however, that our business will continue to generate cash flow at our current level of operations or that anticipated improvements in our current level of operations will be achieved. If we are unable to generate sufficient cash flow from operations to service our debt, we may be required to sell assets, reduce capital expenditures, refinance all or a portion of our indebtedness or obtain additional financing. Our ability to make scheduled principal payments or to pay interest on or to refinance our indebtedness depends on our future performance and financial results, which, to a certain extent, are subject to general conditions in or affecting our industry and to general conditions and factors that are beyond our control. There can be no assurance that sufficient funds will be available to enable us to service our indebtedness or to make capital expenditures. As of December 31, 2020, we do not have any material commitments related to capital expenditures.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: We are not currently a party to any off-balance sheet arrangements.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: In general, our costs are affected by inflation and we may experience the effects of inflation in future periods. Management believes, however, that such effects have not been material to us during the past two years.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: We are party to an Investor Management Agreement with certain funds and vehicles affiliated with Warburg Pincus LLC pursuant to which we receive certain administrative and management services. In exchange for these services, we incurred fees from our sponsors for services rendered for strategic planning, management control matters, external financing and other services of $6.8 million and $5.6 million during the years ended December 31, 2020 and 2019, respectively. Additionally, $1.7 million and $1.4 million in director fees were paid in 2020 and 2019, respectively. In addition, pursuant to our membership agreements, we pay distributions to our members or in some instances we make our tax payments directly to the respective taxing authorities on our members’ behalf, with respect to income tax that they owe on earnings that are allocated to them. During the years ended December 31, 2020 and 2019, distributions aggregating $12.0 million and $3.6 million, respectively, were made to certain unit holders. -----

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures about Market Risk Interest rates
Subsubsection Text: We are exposed to market risk primarily from changes in interest rates. Interest rates on the Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities bear interest at variable rates and therefore actual interest rates could be significantly different than the assumed rates. -----

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Allied Universal is North America’s leading security and facility services provider. With over 250,000 security professionals and offices located throughout the United States as well as internationally (Canada, Mexico, and the United Kingdom), Allied Universal serves approximately 14,800 clients and is responsible for protecting more than 50,000 client sites covering multiple specialty sectors such as higher education, healthcare, retail, commercial real estate, government, and corporate campuses, including a significant portion of the Fortune 500 companies. Allied Universal’s services span manned guarding, innovative technology systems, risk and consulting, janitorial and staffing services, integration services, and digital solutions and remote monitoring. We are responsible for providing “best-in-class” security services that allow clients to completely outsource the recruiting, screening, hiring, training, uniforming, scheduling and supervision of security officers. Our security officers work on-location at customer sites and are responsible for observing, detecting, deterring and reporting and responding to perceived, potential or actual security threats. We also provide specialized security services such as vehicle patrol, visitor management, K-9 security services, top security facility cleared security professionals, and joint security programs. We have an operational presence in all 50 US states, the District of Columbia and Puerto Rico and have a growing presence in Canada, Latin America, and the United Kingdom. In addition to providing manned guarding services, we provide comprehensive technology solutions to our customers, including video surveillance, CCTV picture capture and monitoring, robot patrolling, GPS-based patrol and reporting, management of access control points and centralized security operations. We also offer systems integration services to design, install and service fully integrated technology-based monitoring systems, along with digital solutions and remote monitoring through our MaRC. We are able to leverage our large manned guarding customer base and service platform to cross-sell these additional system integration services. Finally, we offer a range of ancillary services, including temporary and permanent staffing, event staffing and security, janitorial services, and consulting and investigation solutions. Allied Universal was formed in August 2016 through the combination of AlliedBarton and Universal, which brought together two of the leading providers in the security services industry. AlliedBarton, founded in 1957, and Universal, founded in 1965, were leaders in the industry in customer service, organic growth, customer and employee retention, accretive M&A, and had a highly complementary and diverse set of blue chip customers. The combined company became the largest provider of security officer services in North America and has continued to grow since, both organically and through M&A. In the fourth quarter of 2018, Allied Universal acquired U.S. Security Associates Holdings, Inc., a leading North American provider of security solutions, including manned security, consulting, investigations, and disaster and emergency response services. Since 2007, the company has successfully executed 72 acquisitions, including small and large tuck-ins. In the fourth quarter of 2019, Allied announced the acquisition of SOS Security which brought a complementary approach and further scale to Allied Universal. As of 2020, Allied Universal has an estimated 31% share of the highly fragmented outsourced manned guarding security services market in the United States, with a track record of growth driven both organically and through acquisitions. For the year ended December 31, 2020, on a pro forma basis after giving effect to the Transactions, we had Pro Forma Combined Adjusted Revenues of $18,357.1 million and Pro Forma Combined Adjusted EBITDA of $1,955.9 million, respectively. See “—Summary Historical Consolidated and Pro Forma Combined Financial Information” for a reconciliation of Pro Forma Combined Adjusted Revenues and Pro Forma Combined Adjusted EBITDA to revenues and net income (loss), the most directly comparable GAAP and/or IFRS measures.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: On December 8, 2020, the governing boards of Allied Universal and of G4S announced that they had reached agreement on the terms of a recommended cash offer, to be made by Allied Bidco, a newly incorporated entity that is indirectly controlled by Allied Universal, to acquire the entire issued and to be issued share capital of G4S, with G4S’ ----- directors recommending Allied Universal’s offer of 245 pence per share, representing a purchase price of approximately £3.8 billion and total enterprise value of approximately £5.4 billion (the G4S Offer). On March 16, 2021, we announced the offer becoming unconditional as to acceptances, having received valid acceptances representing approximately 79% of total G4S shares. On April 6, 2021, the G4S Offer became wholly unconditional, and we completed the G4S Acquisition.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: G4S is a leading global security company, specializing in the provision of security services and solutions to customers around the world. G4S’s roots can be traced back approximately 120 years ago to 1901, when the guarding company Kjøbenhavn Frederiksberg Nattevagt was established in Denmark. Since then, G4S has expanded both organically and through acquisitions, culminating in the merger of Securicor and Group 4 Falck to create G4S in 2004. G4S is active in 90 countries across the globe, has more than 490,000 security professionals, and purchases goods and services from approximately 40,000 suppliers. G4S has security integration capabilities in more than 40 key markets and more than 13,000 monitored end points with key markets across the Americas, Africa, Asia and EMEA. Key services include system design, integration & maintenance, manned & mobile guarding, monitoring & response, consultancy & risk management, analytics, equipment and software. G4S provides its services to a broad range of customers across various types of sites, including Fortune 500 companies, construction sites and manufacturing facilities, hospital campuses and healthcare facilities, oil, gas, energy and other regulated facilities, financial institutions and banking centers, college and university campuses, courthouses and government buildings, law enforcement support including detainee processing and transport, and gated and residential communities. The G4S business model starts with anticipating customer needs through detailed risk assessments. G4S is investing in the resources, skills and capabilities needed to market, design, build, operate and maintain technologyenabled Integrated Security solutions. Through its Secure Solutions segment, G4S is a global market leader in security, providing both traditional manned-guarding and technology-enabled security solutions in addition to consultancy services and analytics to its customers. G4S uses its expertise, service delivery and integration alongside its geographic scale to differentiate the business to customers, drive outsourcing and enhance the value of traditional security services through greater use of technology. G4S officers are tailored for the specific need of each client, including the following: custom protection officers who meet stringent experience and training requirements and are prepared to step into high profile locations; upscale security officers who perform security patrols of designated areas on foot or in a vehicle; lobby ambassadors who present a professional and courteous appearance while also possessing customer service skills and focus and bank protection officers who provide visible deterrence of criminal activity at entrances of financial institutions and banking centers. Currently, technology-enabled security services represent approximately 45% of Secure Solutions revenue. G4S is focused on pivoting from manned guarding to “predictive” security services with consulting, technology, people and data analytics to continue margin expansion going forward. G4S’s Cash Solutions segment is comprised of the Retail Technology Solutions and Conventional Cash divisions. On February 26, 2020, G4S announced it agreed to sell the majority of its Conventional Cash businesses to Brink’s for cash consideration of £666 million, allowing it to focus on the growth of its core integrated security solutions business and further develop the rapidly growing Retail Technology Solutions business. Retail Technology Solutions provides unique, value-add cash management solutions to clients and goes to market through the brands Retail Cash Solutions, CASH360, Desposita, G4SPay, and South Africa-Deposits. G4S technologies offer a breadth of solutions to clients including automated cash management and reconciliation and unique forecasting tools for retail cash operations. Conventional Cash services include armored cash transportation, typically facilitated between cash centers and customer outlets, as well as counterfeit detection, cash redistribution to banks and ATMs, ATM management, including cash forecasting, replenishment, reconciliation and maintenance, counting and secure international transportation of cash and valuables including, but not limited to, currency, gems and precious metals. G4S’s Consulting Services segment helps clients manage and react to risks, such as risks associated with crime, terrorism and entering into new markets, by providing remote site services and facilities management capability in low infrastructure, conflict afflicted and hostile environments. Such services include security, aviation security, facilities management, life support, remote logistics and fleet management, and training and capacity building services. Additionally, the G4S Ordnance Management teams help clear explosives and other forms of ordnance from sites that were once occupied by ISIS. ----- G4S’s Care & Justice Services segment, which is concentrated in the United Kingdom and Australia, provides custody and detention, rehabilitation, education, employment, electronic monitoring, immigration and borders, police back office support, secure healthcare and non-urgent patient transport services to central and local governments and their agencies, regulatory bodies, UK police forces and the private sector. The Care & Justice Services segment also provides critical primary and forensic healthcare services for the public and private sectors and provides healthcare services within police custody suites and other secure environments, caring for detainee health needs and supporting the collection of forensic samples. Further, as a responsible employer, G4S’s priorities embrace sustainable investment to promote the health and safety of employees, as reflected in the improvement in G4S’s health and safety performance over the past seven years. For example, during 2020, 15 G4S employees lost their lives in the course of carrying out their duties, as compared with 20 fatalities in 2019, which was significantly lower than levels experienced in earlier years, reflecting the benefits of G4S’s health and safety programs. G4S continues to reduce its employee injury rate, and lost time injury rates also improved, falling from 5.7 per 1,000 employees in 2019 to 4.6 in 2020. In addition, during 2020, G4S launched a mental health awareness campaign entitled Ready to Work, recognizing that communities have been under additional stress during the year with the impact of COVID-19, which program will continue into 2021. In terms of risk mitigation, G4S believes that behaving with integrity and respect is key to G4S’ core values, forming an integral part of the G4S’s strategy and an essential foundation on which G4S carries out its business. To that end, in 2020, G4S reviewed and relaunched a number of its ethics and social responsibility policies. G4S’s new Ethics Code sets out the ethical standards which apply to all G4S businesses and employees. This was launched early in 2021, supported by an extensive communications, training and engagement program. In addition, G4S has also updated its whistleblowing policy, anti-bribery & corruption framework and its human rights policy and accompanying guidance. G4S has also refreshed its training program on ABC. To ensure the training is effective and reaches those who need it, in addition to all new employees, all managers and staff with responsibility for making any financial decisions and for controlling assets have been prioritized to undertake the new ABC training and to repeat it annually. Given the significant re-shaping of G4S’s business portfolio in recent years, we believe that the G4S is now positioned to develop an enhanced service mix with a growing proportion of higher value Integrated Security services. The combined benefits of the G4S strategy, strong execution, emphasis on employee health and safety, continued focus on risk mitigation and rapid response to COVID-19 are reflected in G4S’s underlying results for the year ended December 31, 2020. Please see “Summary—Summary Historical Consolidated Financial Information of G4S” and the audited financial statements of G4S and accompanying notes thereto included elsewhere in this offering circular.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Strategic Rationale Enhances the combined company’s geographic coverage and capabilities to serve customers, especially in the core North America market, which represents approximately 70% of pro forma combined revenues
Subsubsection Text: We believe the G4S acquisition is a strategically and financially compelling transaction that will expand our geographic footprint, enhance our scale, diversify our products and services offering, increase market position and provide new growth channels in untapped regions and end-markets. The acquisition of G4S provides Allied Universal with a unique opportunity to acquire a well-established integrated security services company with a globally recognized security services brand, and platform to increase the combined company’s top line sales and profitability. Allied Universal and G4S are two of the top five global companies in the highly fragmented security services industry based on revenue. Together, we will be a global leading company in the security services. The transaction enhances the combined company’s geographic coverage and capabilities to serve customers, especially in the core North America market, which represents approximately 70% of pro forma combined revenues. Allied Universal has a strong footprint in North America with a presence in all 50 states, and the merger with G4S creates unparalleled scale and increases density, with footprint overlap allowing the combined company to take a bestof approach to servicing clients in the various regions. Based on revenue generation, we rank number one in Manned Guarding and Retail Technology solutions and number three in Security Technology in North America. We provide a comprehensive, diverse product offering with value-added services and world-class quality to our end-customers. We believe our increased scale in multiple regions and the breadth of our services will make our services more ----- attractive to our customers. Both Allied Universal and G4S provide diversified solutions in addition to traditional manned guarding services. The Allied Universal and G4S transaction creates a fully integrated security business with the ability to address customers’ evolving security needs in an increasingly evolving and fast-changing world with increased demand.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Increases diversification across end-markets, customers and geographies
Subsubsection Text: While Allied Universal has historically focused more on the North American region, the acquisition of G4S enables Allied Universal to significantly increase its global footprint and diversify its base to operating in over 90 countries. The combination with G4S establishes Allied Universal as a global security services leader with unmatched scale and expertise in providing quality security services across a range of geographies. The combination of Allied Universal’s and G4S’s solutions and significant manned-guarding businesses will create a global one-stop-shop for customers and a business ideally positioned to lead the industry shift from traditional security officer and patrol services towards services that integrate technology solutions with manned security services. See “—Industry Overview—Security Services Technology.” Allied Universal’s decades of experience in risk advisory and consulting, investigations, executive protection and emergency response will complement G4S’s corporate risk services to provide end-to-end security solutions. With appropriate support, capital and assistance from Allied Universal, G4S would be able to concentrate on addressing the ongoing industry shift towards electronic and technology-based services.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Strengthens platform with blue chip customer base
Subsubsection Text: The combination of Allied Universal and G4S will create a world-leading integrated security business providing services to an extensive portfolio of blue-chip clients across the public and private sectors. We sell to a diversified customer base and end-markets in various verticals, including commercial real estate, retail and malls, government, healthcare, tech and media, manufacturing and industrial, financial institution, chemical and petrochemical, and aerospace and defense. We are the trusted provider to premium accounts for clients with greater than $5 million annual revenue across multiple regions and a central point of contact for purchasing security services. Our leading global scale helps promote trust and confidence among our sophisticated customers and serves as a significant differentiator versus regional competitors. The combination expands Allied Universal’s base of long tenured blue chip customers globally and uniquely positions the combined company to serve customers seeking integrated security solutions providers of scale. Allied Universal has had annual revenue retention of over 90% for the past 5 years and has minimal customer concentration with top five customers representing less than 5% of revenues. Doing business and negotiating long-term contracts through a centralized procurement division drives strong valueadded partnerships underpinned by highly sticky relationships, which increase the switching costs for our customers.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Acquisition adds density and expertise to North America technology business
Subsubsection Text: The combined group will increase Allied Universal’s reach and depth of services, enhancing our leadership position and allowing us to expand internationally on current domestic accounts. While Allied Universal has an established customer base with significant density in traditional manned-guarding services, G4S will contribute to our operational scale in Retail Cash solutions and Retail Technology solutions, which have grown since launching in 2015. We see this as a new services platform, especially in our security technology services that we can cross-sell with North American customers and improve Allied Universal’s services coverage. The expansion of Allied Universal’s technology services platform capabilities will enable the combined company to offer superior client service, with greater breadth, accountability, improved efficiency and cost savings. We have competitive advantages through strong trajectory relative to competitors and potential disruptors and we transfer our knowledge and experience in the United States to deploy our abilities to compete in adjacent markets.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: We intend to deploy operational and strategic best practices across Allied Universal and G4S to drive additional growth, enable cross-selling capabilities, enhance operational performance and increase free cash flow conversion. We estimate that the combination will unlock approximately $155 million in targeted annual cost savings once G4S is fully integrated and our cost savings initiatives have been fully implemented. Allied Universal has a strong track record of successful acquisition integration, including synergy realization. We anticipate that our disciplined management of fixed and variable operating expenses, revenue and financing synergies, as well as ----- corporate overhead and headcount rationalization will primarily drive cost synergies. Historically, we have made a significant number of acquisitions and we have well-developed systems and processes throughout our organization to support integration efforts, resulting in more efficient synergy realization and helping drive overall margin improvement. The overlapping business functions in North America provide a significant opportunity for real estate and personnel rationalization. Due to overlapping operations, we expect significant synergies in the following areas in the North America region: general and administrative expenses, duplicative service contracts, insurance, and facilities expense. Additionally, we will be able to eliminate any expenses in functional support areas that support G4S’s status as a public listed company. Further, we believe opportunities exist to increase operating leverage through diversification across investment in capabilities, such as additional training and technology deployments.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: The global contract security services market is large, has been stable and is expected to continue its consistent growth supported by a number of favorable trends. The US security services market was estimated to generate approximately $66 billion in revenue in 2020 and is expected to grow at a 4% to 5% CAGR from 2021 to 2025. The US security services market for outsourced manned guarding generated over $28 billion in revenue in 2020 and grew at a 4.3% CAGR from 2017 to 2020. The security technology market in the US is also large, with revenues estimated to be approximately $17 billion in 2020, and grew slightly quicker than the manned guarding segment, at a CAGR of approximately 8% from 2017 to 2020. The market was estimated to be comprised of approximately 42% manned guarding and 25% security technology. Internationally, the security services market for manned guarding grew to $34 billion in revenue in 2020 and is expected to reach approximately $40 billion in revenue in 2025, representing an estimated compound annual growth rate of 5% from 2021 to 2025. A heightened focus on security, both in the United States and globally, has been driven by high profile gun violence, domestic terrorism events, a rise in workplace incidents and both peaceful and violent protest events, which have led to increased spending on security. Our service offerings represent an important first line of defense against potential security threats. Meanwhile, mega trends occurring around the world and positive growth tailwinds in the distribution, manufacturing, healthcare and education sectors also support demand for increasing security. In addition, organizations continue to outsource their security services primarily to alleviate administrative burdens and achieve cost savings, while the compelling value proposition delivered through scale, broad service offerings and robust technological infrastructure drive them to shift to highly professionalized providers. Given the high-risk exposure of inadequate security, we believe that customers make purchasing decisions based on service quality, reliability, and reputation, rather than price alone. It has been our experience that customers seek out and maintain long-term relationships with quality providers. For example, industry switching rates have historically been between 10% to 15% on average annually, and customer retention rates are higher for large customers served under national contracts, according to a third party consulting study. Meanwhile, Allied Universal, as a scale provider, experienced below average annual customer switching rates of between 5% to 10%. We believe the industry’s stability in various economic cycles is underpinned by the recession-resistant nature of security services, resulting in limited cyclicality and customer churn. Over a ten-year period, industry growth has been consistent, and historically recession-resistant, experiencing only one year of flat-to-slightly declining growth. The impact of economic downturns on labor markets, which includes higher employee retention, and subsequently lower unbilled overtime, recruiting and training costs, historically have led to EBITDA margin expansion, which has historically been sustained during a return to economic expansion. Our experience during 2020 demonstrates the resiliency of our business model. Despite lockdowns and office closures during the COVID pandemic, security services remained an essential part of real estate management and asset protection. During this period, we also experienced a temporary shift in demand from security services in connection with retail, travel and leisure to grocery and other essential businesses. We also experienced an increase in demand for higher value-add services such as temperature screening. During the summer of 2020, protests and other civil events drove demand for our manned guarding services, providing further diversification and resiliency against office closings. ----- US Outsourced Security Guard Industry ($ in billions)

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: The US security services and security technology integration and manned guarding market is expected to grow at a CAGR of approximately 5% from 2021 through 2025. Several positive trends support this growth, including: (i) baseline expansion from building stock growth, guard penetration in existing buildings, and wage rate growth which is passed on through the mark-up model used to price security services; (ii) secular demand growth due to heightened focus on security driven by increased acts of violence and media coverage, increasing regulatory and insurance scrutiny; and (iii) increased outsourcing rate for security services. Furthermore, there is a trend toward the centralization of security programs and integration of manned guarding with technology solutions, both of which favor best-in-class national providers. As the national player with vertical markets expertise and differentiated integrated security and technology solutions, we are well-positioned to benefit from favorable industry tailwinds. Globally, demand for security services has also increased steadily and is expected to grow at a CAGR of 4.9% between 2020 and 2024. Demand is driven by similar factors as in the United States as well as elevated safety and security risks and concerns driven by geopolitical events such as refuge crises, increased wealth driven by urbanization, global GDP growth, rising labor costs supporting demand for higher-value, technology-enabled, integrated security solutions and demand for higher-value service lines driven by more advanced technology capabilities. The COVID pandemic demonstrated the industry’s resilience as the global security services market continued to experience growth despite lockdowns throughout much of the world.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Base-line industry growth is driven by underlying economic growth, growing wage rates and increasing building stock, as each new building adds incremental demand for the security services industry. While building stock growth provides strong underlying support for the security services market, it is not necessary to sustain growth within our existing customer bases. A growing economy drives up overall wage rates, increases statutory minimum wages and provides union increases, all which are typically passed on to customers through a stable mark-up. Increased wage rates are expected to continue driving further expansion of the manned guarding market and increase revenue generation from existing clients.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Security services remain critical and non-discretionary as customers overwhelmingly value the role of security officers in deterring criminal activity and other incidents, all the while providing assurance against real or perceived security threats. In cases of security incidents, customers value the officers’ ability to provide immediate response. Technology can enhance and significantly improve security but we believe there is no substitute for the physical presence of well-trained and dedicated security personnel who can respond to threats in real-time. ----- The demand for security services continues to increase due to heightened security concerns stemming from the ongoing threat of terrorism and high profile gun violence, large protest events, heightened importance of public and workplace safety, refugee crises and the growing need to supplement services provided by the public sector. Heightened media coverage of security lapses, growing costs of disruption, and stricter security requirements by government institutions and private insurers have forced organizations to take greater responsibility for their own security.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Increased Outsourcing to Third-party Providers with National and Global Scale
Subsubsection Text: Currently, approximately 65% of manned security services in the United States are outsourced to professional security services firms, and this outsourcing rate is expected to increase incrementally over time. The trend toward outsourcing is expected to continue to drive growth in the industry due to the strong value proposition of contract security service providers and non-core nature of security for the vast majority of companies. Due to the growing complexity surrounding security-related issues and increased demand for vertical segment expertise and customized guarding services, outsourcing security services to “best-in-class” providers continues to be an attractive option for customers. Contract security services firms can offer customers improved security, reduced non-core administrative burden, and competitive pricing through operating leverage, each of which are compelling reasons supporting the trend toward outsourcing various business services. Outsourcing of non-core functions has not only become a corporate best practice, but also a function of the public sector as governments look to minimize cost. Outsourcing allows companies and governments to reduce labor costs and shift the administrative burden of non-core functions to third-party vendors with more experience, operating leverage, and functional area expertise. As one of the few security and facility services providers with national and global scale, we believe the combined Allied Universal and G4S business is well-positioned to benefit from the trend toward outsourcing security services. For example, we are able to address customers’ increasingly complex security needs and their preference for best-in-class providers with strong reputations and vertical markets expertise, rather than local providers. In addition, as national customers increasingly seek to consolidate vendors, they build relationships with national partners that can reliably and consistently serve them across multiple regions. Finally, the increased centralization of procurement continues to drive the shift in customer decision-making from a local level to a multi-region and national level, providing an opportunity for national providers to increase customer penetration.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Due to the importance of having security officers physically present to deter and quickly respond to incidents, technology has been used primarily to enhance and better enable manned security services. Security services providers such as Allied Universal and G4S continue to broaden their portfolio of services by combining value-added offerings like access controls, ID verification, video monitoring, and communications systems with traditional security officer and patrol services. Customers seek integration between manned guarding services and complementary technology solutions in order to improve and reduce the complexity of their security operations. Existing customer relationships create the ability to cross-sell services for the installation, integration and maintenance of physical technology systems that augment manned guarding services. Integrated technology solutions enhance the value delivered to customers and foster customer retention. They provide a recurring revenue model for providers, as they require one-time sales and installations but involve regular system services and maintenance.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Over the past eight years, the contract security services industry has consolidated through increased M&A activity. Given the sustained fragmented nature of the industry, this trend is expected to continue in the near to intermediate term. Reflecting the strong customer preference for national and increasingly global scale providers and the operational and cost advantages of having local density, large contract security services providers continue to gain market share. Together, Allied Universal and G4S will hold a leading market position and we expect to further growth market share in the security services industry in the United States and globally in connection with the business combination. -----

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Competitive Strengths Largest Security Services Provider Worldwide
Subsubsection Text: Following the G4S Acquisition, Allied Universal has become the global leader in security services and the acquisition reinforced our number one position in North America. Combined with G4S, we increased our scale and density, further enhancing our ability to deliver consistent, high quality services across our operations infrastructure. We have achieved industry-leading growth over the last decade through both organic and accretive M&A activities. We serve a significant portion of Fortune 500 companies, and generated Pro Forma Combined Adjusted Revenues of $18,357.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2020. See “—Summary Historical Consolidated and Pro Forma Combined Financial Information” for a reconciliation of Pro Forma Combined Adjusted Revenues to revenues, the most directly comparable GAAP and/or IFRS measure. On a pro forma basis after giving effect to the Transactions, we employ approximately 740,000 security professionals and operate in more than 225 locations in all 50 US states, the District of Columbia and Puerto Rico and have a growing presence in Canada, Brazil, Colombia, Peru, Argentina, Chile, Benelux, United Kingdom, Saudi Arabia, UAE, India, Australia, Thailand, Hong Kong, South Africa, Morocco and Kenya. Our national scale also enables us to serve strategic industry verticals such as high-rise offices, aerospace and defense, higher education and healthcare. With the acquisition of G4S, Allied Universal has significant density in local markets in the United States and regional markets worldwide, which drives a competitive advantage in serving our customers, providing a location-specific approach with the benefits of a global platform. Our local density enables us to serve a wide range of client sizes while achieving operational leverage at the branch level by keeping overhead expenses as a percentage of revenue lower than the industry average. ----- G4S Acquisition enhances Allied Universal’s Local Density and Ability to Serve in Each Market Note: Shows hours per week (HPW) in each region before and after the G4S Acquisition.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: The resilient nature of the security services market was demonstrated during the COVID pandemic, which reaffirmed the essential nature of services provided by Allied Universal. Early in the pandemic, security professionals were generally deemed essential by health authorities and continued to deliver security services to a range of customers. Minor business disruptions at the onset of lockdowns led to a slight pullback in hours relative to the preCOVID period. Allied Universal has so far successfully managed the pandemic and performance has been highly resilient both in top line growth and in margin expansion. Hours have since rebounded and even increased in some regions as COVID-related restrictions have eased and economic activity continues to rebound, while increased security concerns remain. Services have continued to expand as customers seek a partner to help implement and execute new policies and procedures at guarded sites, in addition to offering additional services such as temperature checks. An enhanced focus on innovative technology solutions drives further upside for security providers that offer fully integrated solutions. Allied Universal’s resilient top-line is driven by the contractual revenue streams with daily re-occurrence of services, the critical nature of security to operations, and the low cost of security services relative to the high cost of failure. The company typically benefits from rising wages as increases are passed on to clients, who generally expect a 2% to 3% annual increase in billing rates, in-line with wage growth. Tightening labor markets result in stable margins, while softer markets typically drive margin expansion as the increased supply of labor reduces the spread between bill rates and employee pay rates. US Minimum Wage ($/hour) and US Unemployment Rate -----

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Compelling Growth Tailwinds in the United States and Across the Globe
Subsubsection Text: The critical and non-discretionary nature of security services to customers is driving stable, consistent growth both in the United States and globally. The US security services market generated approximately $66 billion in revenue in 2020, and is expected to grow at a CAGR of 5% between 2021 and 2025. Globally, the manned guarding market generated approximately $34 billion in revenue in 2020, and is expected to grow at a CAGR of 5% from 2021 to 2025. The international technology security services market generated approximately $8 billion in revenue in 2020, and is expected to grow at a CAGR of 4% from 2021 to 2025. Demand for high quality security services continues to grow through heightened focus on security, increasing public safety awareness and the growing need to supplement services provided by the public sector. The trend of outsourcing to high quality providers such as Allied Universal will continue to be supported by a compelling value proposition, increasing security complexity and centralization of security programs. There is a low risk of technology disruption as only manned security is considered an active deterrent to perceived security threats. Further, technology solutions enhance rather than displace manned guarding and Allied Universal provides customers with a best-in-class technology integrated service offering. These tailwinds, combined with attractive end-market growth across diversified verticals, support attractive market growth across all key geographies serviced by the combined company.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Highly Diversified Revenue Mix Across High Growth Customer Base
Subsubsection Text: In the United States, Allied Universal has a highly diversified revenue mix across all major regions and metropolitan areas, end markets, and customers. We have limited customer concentration, as our top 10 customers account for 10.7% of revenue for the year ended December 31, 2020, with no customer contributing more than 1.9% of revenue during that period. Finally, we serve a variety of distinct vertical segments, none of which account for more than 11% of revenue. This end market diversification shields us from industry-specific shocks and allows us to provide vertical-specific solutions necessitated by the increasing complexity of security issues in different end markets. We also benefit from our commercial real estate customers’ diverse tenant base and most of our mall clients being considered “class A” (representing high sales per square foot), which achieve steadier foot traffic and higher guard penetration. The combined company will benefit from an expanded blue-chip client base, including a significant portion of the Fortune 500, and vertical market clients, as well as a diversified revenue mix across North America, Asia Pacific, Europe & Middle East, and Africa. The largest revenue mix by customer type is major corporate & industrial, which accounted for roughly 21% of combined revenue for the year ended December 31, 2020, followed by government, with 13% of combined revenue, financial institutions, with 9% of combined revenue, retail and malls, with 7% of combined revenue, technology, media and telecommunication, with 6% of combined revenue, commercial real estate, with 6% of combined revenue, transportation and logistics, with 6% of combined revenue, chemical and energy/utilities, with 6% of combined revenue, healthcare, with 5% of combined revenue, manufacturing and industrial, with 3% of combined revenue, aerospace and defense, with 2% of combined revenue, and education, with 2% of combined revenue, in each case, for the year ended December 31, 2020. This geographical and end-market diversification provides us mobility to continue to grow revenue through multiple channels. ----- Board Array of Customers Served

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Blue Chip Customers, High Customer Retention Rates
Subsubsection Text: We serve a diverse base of blue-chip clients across a variety of industries and regions. Currently, our client portfolio includes members of the Fortune 500 companies and is characterized by long-term relationships and high retention rates. Select Blue Chip Clients ----- We have historically fostered long-term client relationships through our: - commitment to providing high-quality, responsive services; - active client service, sales and marketing efforts; - wide geographic scope and client-centric approach; and - consistent service offerings. These characteristics are responsible for Allied Universal’s highly recurring client bases which have had over 90% revenue retention over the last 5 years. Allied Universal additionally has a platform for serving premier customers in the United States, which we define as clients with greater than $5 million of annual revenue across multiple regions and with a central point of contact for purchasing security services. Our large national footprint in the United States and operational scale with local density across the country enables us to be well-positioned to meet the needs of premier customers. We have a contractual revenue base, with three to five year contracts for large customer accounts, and one-year evergreen contracts for smaller accounts. We use a data-driven sales and account management process to take proactive measures to expand and renew contracts well ahead of contract expiration.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Premier Employer in the Industry with Better Than Industry Training and Employee Retention
Subsubsection Text: Client satisfaction is at the heart of our success and we rely on our employees to deliver consistent, highquality service. To ensure industry-leading service, we have cultivated a strong corporate culture that focuses on personal career development and we reward long-term, quality service. We offer competitive compensation with above-average security provider hourly wages, comprehensive training programs, career management tools, leadership training and performance assessment processes for managers and executives to ensure that they are attracting, engaging with, and retaining the highest quality security officers. We ensure that security professionals have the appropriate training for each client need; for example, portions of our security professionals have military service experience and CPR certification. Additionally, our commitment to the professional development of our employees has resulted in 65% of managerial positions being filled through internal promotion. Lower employee turnover rates reduce recruiting, screening, training costs and increases service quality for our customers, facilitating long-term, stable relationships. Employee culture is also a key focus at G4S, where 84% of employees reported a favorable view of the company in its 2019 global employee survey, with the results used to inform both local engagement plans and company-wide initiatives. In addition, Allied Universal has consistently been recognized for superior employee training and talent development programs. Over the past several years, we received additional awards, including Chief Learning Officer magazine’s LearningElite Award, The American Society for Training & Development Excellence in Practice Award, Chief Executive Magazine’s Best Private Companies for Leaders Award, and Orange County Business Journal’s Best Places to Work award. Allied Universal’s digital employee engagement and safety solutions, including our proprietary Mercury solution, provide consistent and reliable electronic communication channels with our approximately 250,000 security professionals, ensuring collaborative interactions, including “on the clock” training, assignments delivery and schedule modifications. We have implemented an automated hiring and recruiting process, which includes an artificial intelligence enhanced interview process and progresses applicants on a 24-7-365 basis. We use custom algorithms to qualify and screen candidates based on top Allied Universal current security professionals, enabling managers and operators in field to focus on client service rather than recruiting. Finally, our proprietary business intelligence tool is utilized by thousands of managers in the business to optimize pricing, staffing, safety and compliance. ----- Security Professional Turnover: Allied Universal and Industry Average Notes: Figures shown for Allied Universal’s security professional turnover; turnover amongst non-security professionals is significantly lower. Industry average based on management estimates and industry research. Represents total turnover amongst employees with greater three or six months of tenure; no adjustment made for turnover driven by business churn. Based on management estimates.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Stable and Predictable Financial Performance Coupled with Strong Free Cash Flow Generation
Subsubsection Text: _Consistent history of growth: Allied Universal has repeatedly demonstrated the ability to deliver growth,_ consistent and improving profitability, and strong cash flow. The nature of our customer contracts fosters a highly visible financial model. Our recurring revenue base is supported by an above-average customer retention rate. To drive revenue growth, both companies target new client wins, in particular the expansion of the premier customers portfolio within Allied Universal, expanded scope of work and customer penetration with existing clients, added complementary technology solutions, and consistent increases in price in line with wage rate growth and the delivery of high- quality services. These organic growth drivers, coupled with our ability to execute upon accretive acquisition opportunities, have contributed to strong revenue and Adjusted EBITDA growth. From 2005 to 2020, Allied Universal’s standalone organic revenue CAGR was approximately 6% and from 2017 to 2020, Allied Universal consistently grew the spread between bill rates and wage rates per hour by approximately 4.5%. Allied Universal’s disciplined acquisition strategy combined with strong organic growth has allowed us to become the fastest growing security services company in the industry while maintaining strong free cash flow generation. The combination between Allied Universal and G4S is expected to drive further topline and profitability growth through significant cross-selling and cost synergy opportunities. _Highly-variable cost structure drives predictable margins: Bill rate, which is the price we charge to our_ customers per hour per security officer, is priced as a mark-up on security officer pay rates, which is the wage we pay to security guards per hour. From 2016 to 2020, Allied Universal’s mark-up has remained constant at 1.48x. This stable mark-up reflects the strong track record of passing on cost increases to clients and expanding margins. Our ability to pass through labor costs and other variable expenses to our clients allows us to generate consistent profitability and produce cash flows with low volatility. This consistency helps us maintain stable operating margins and provides a baseline level of profitability from which further margin expansion can be achieved as we continue to increase our operating leverage and scale, while reducing general and administrative expenses. _Capital-light business model supports strong cash flow: Our minimal capital requirements and strong_ working capital management support our strong cash flow profile. Capital expenditures over the past three years were approximately 1.8% of annual revenue on average, with cash capital expenditures representing about half of such capital expenditures and the remaining portion funded through capital leases. We also have minimal and predictable net working capital needs, which provides further visibility into free cash flow. ----- _Allied Universal Markup $ per hour[(1)]_ (1) Mark-up $ per hour is calculated as core bill rates less core wage rates; 2007-2015 represents AlliedBarton Only; 2016-2020 represents Allied Universal.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Proven Platform for Continued Organic Growth and Disciplined Approach to M&A
Subsubsection Text: We have demonstrated consistent growth, both organically and inorganically. We have historically grown approximately 6% organically, driven by our best-in-class service offering, continued scale increase, technologically advanced offerings and strong secular tailwinds. Utilizing a disciplined approach, we have demonstrated a strong track record of sourcing, executing and integrating both tuck-in and transformative acquisitions. Through these acquisitions, we have achieved meaningful cost synergies as well as customer, end market and geographic diversity. We have completed 72 acquisitions since 2007 with a majority being proprietary opportunities acquired at mid-single digit purchase multiples. We have historically achieved approximately 98% revenue retention within the 12 months postacquisition, further demonstrating our ability to successfully integrate targets onto our platform while continuing to provide high quality service to customers. We continue to maintain a propriety pipeline of potential targets as we continue to execute our roll-up strategy.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: We have a highly experienced and well-respected management team with a proven track record and meaningful equity ownership. Management was responsible for developing and implementing the expansion strategy that has led to industry-leading growth for the company. The team has a strong track record of continuously evolving and growing the business through both organic and M&A strategies, and is experienced in integrating accretive acquisitions. The team is committed to delivering continued growth, and has significant equity ownership in Allied Universal. Outside of the executive management group, there is a deep bench of leadership and operational talent throughout the organization given the selection of the best security specialists in connection with the merger of AlliedBarton and Universal in 2016.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: Growth Strategy Proven Ability to Win New Clients and Grow with Existing Clients
Subsubsection Text: Our underlying organic growth has historically been driven by hours growth attributable to (i) developing a world-class sales and marketing organization, (ii) leveraging our competitive advantages to win new customers, including premier customers, (iii) expanding customer penetration and leveraging cross-selling opportunities with clients by delivering customized service offerings specific to customer needs, and (iv) maintaining steady underlying customer retention rates in the 90% range in the long term, and pricing growth driven by passing on pay rate increases to customers. In order to drive new customer wins for Allied Universal, our sales organization is structured by salespeople focused on premier customers, salespeople focused on regional and local accounts, vertical market specialists, and regional specialists. Our sales pipeline is robust, with the pipeline typically representing a multiple of the annual new starts target. Premier customers sales efforts target customers with facilities in multiple locations throughout the United States, who increasingly desire consistency of service, fewer points of contact and alignment with a national partner providing a full suite of capabilities. As we have expanded our geographical footprint and adapted sales and client service capabilities, we have become well-positioned to be the leading provider to premier customers . With our existing customers, we seek to grow customer penetration by increasing the number of customer sites served and thus the hours that our security officers cover, and adding on different types of security services. Our organic growth is supported by underlying customer retention rates in the 90% range over the past 10 years. Given the multi-year contractual nature of many of our large contracts, we have visibility over a significant portion of our ----- revenue . We proactively manage contracts in advance of renewal, rebid or expiration. Finally, organic growth has been driven by increasing pricing in line with security officer pay rate increases. We have demonstrated a history of successfully increasing bill rates with pay rates, as evidenced by stable mark-up rate and increasing mark-up spread over the long term. We have grown our revenue at a CAGR of approximately 6% between 2005 and 2020. We believe we are well-positioned to continue achieving measured growth by capitalizing on our strong reputation, enhanced operational capabilities, vertical-specific service expertise and premier customers platform. In addition to increasing hours by adding new accounts, benefiting from increased outsourcing, we will continue to leverage our significant experience managing pricing dynamics to drive growth.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: The combination of Allied Universal and G4S is expected to generate meaningful cross-selling opportunities. The combined comprehensive offering of security solutions across a global platform will allow the combined business to serve as a one-stop-shop for existing customers served by the combined group, as well as new clients looking for a global provider to serve their security needs. The expertise of each organization in serving specific end markets and geographies will increase the overall reach and ability to serve global clients across a range of industries with a host of complimentary services. Our industry-leading manned guarding services provide a platform from which to continue offering additional services. To date, we have utilized this platform to offer additional services, such as physical technology systems, including video surveillance, CCTV picture capture and monitoring, robot patrolling, GPS based patrol and reporting, online threat monitoring, and managing access control points and centralized security operation. Additionally, we also offer integration services to design, install and service fully integrated technology-based monitoring systems. Finally, we provide digital solutions and remote monitoring through MaRC. Our acquisition of Securadyne in April 2019 further strengthened our ability to consult, design, deploy, integrate and maintain electronic security systems for our customers. We believe the Securadyne acquisition provided us with the footprint and scalable infrastructure that enables us to deliver complementary security integration services to a significantly larger portion of the existing approximately 50,000 client sites where we provide manned guarding services today. In addition to system installation, maintenance, robots, and monitoring, we have integrated technology into our manned guarding services and are in the process of deploying a custom IMS that provides real-time incident data reporting and situational awareness information powered by artificial intelligence. The proprietary application, HeliAUS, provides in-depth incident reporting, data collection, and predictive analytics, allowing managers and clients to spot trends and react quickly, while improving workforce supervision and improving liability management. The highly scalable platform is delivered to customers via a monthly subscription and is billed directly to users as a supplement to manned guarding services. Beyond our technology offerings, we intend to continue to grow our janitorial and staffing services, which are a portfolio of offerings including cleaning services and a provider of skilled talent across a diverse set of industries such as traditional janitorial functions as well as highly specialized cleaning services such as bio- hazard disposal, IT room cleaning, and recycling programs.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: We benefit from our significant experience in successfully integrating acquisitions while maintaining relationships with both existing and acquired customers. The largely fragmented security services industry has historically provided opportunities to supplement our strong organic growth with a disciplined acquisition strategy. A large and fragmented international market, as well as relevant adjacent markets, provides additional opportunity for targeted expansion. Our approach to acquisitions has been highly methodical and focused on scale-building and infill acquisitions. Integration occurs quickly, generally within 30 days for a typical tuck-in acquisition, making for a seamless transition for customers. ----- Allied Universal has proven experience executing all types of transactions, including 72 small tuck-ins and large transformational acquisitions since 2007. On average, these acquisitions were completed at credit accretive, midsingle digit multiples. In addition to many small and medium tuck-ins, we have a proven track record of successfully executing and integrating transformative acquisitions, as evidenced by the combination of AlliedBarton and Universal in August 2016, as well as the large tuck-in acquisition of USSA, formerly the fourth-largest manned guarding provider in the United States in 2018. The combination of our smaller tuck-in acquisitions along with our ability to acquire targets of scale, such as USSA, demonstrate our disciplined ability to take advantage of growth opportunities as they become available. We believe we are an “acquirer of choice” due to our strong reputation and track record and are the bestpositioned consolidator in a highly fragmented market. A significant portion of our past acquisitions have been completed on a proprietary basis. Additionally, we estimate that over 40% of the outsourced manned guarding services market in the United States is comprised of over 7,000 firms and roughly 60% of the security technology services market is comprised of over 3,000 firms, providing a large opportunity set for further accretive consolidation. We benefit from significant industrial logic from on-boarding sub-scale providers onto our scalable platform which drives the ability to expand margins of acquired companies. We believe the combination of Allied Universal and G4S will allow us to execute further our disciplined and well-demonstrated M&A playbook in key markets globally.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Through understanding our customers’ needs, we aim to offer value added, innovative, cost effective security solutions and build enduring relationships. We engage with our customers through a variety of methods, including a consultative approach to selling and bidding for contracts, proactive relationship management and a sharp focus on customer service. Key areas of interests for customers include quality and price of service delivery, expertise and innovation, health and safety and business ethics. However, the industries in which we operate are competitive. We directly compete with companies that are national and international in scope. We also compete with smaller local and regional companies that may have better knowledge of the local conditions in their regions, are better known locally and are better able to gain customers in their regions. There are relatively low barriers to entry in the industries in which we operate, and we have faced and expect to continue to face additional competition from new entrants. We also face increased competition from technology companies as digital advancement develops, which may lead to pricing pressure and service changes. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to Our Business and Industries—The industries in which we operate are intensely competitive and price-sensitive. If we cannot successfully compete with new or existing providers of products and services similar to ours or enhance our existing products and services, our results of operations and financial condition will be adversely affected.” The United States contract security officer industry is highly competitive but fragmented. We also compete with numerous smaller regional and local security service providers in the United States. We believe that the principal competitive factors in the security service market are: - the quality of security officers, including length of service and tenure; - supervision, recruiting, selecting and training of security officers; - management quality and responsiveness; - the ability to handle multiple sites nationwide; and - price in relation to the quality of service. Rapid technological advances, changing delivery models and evolving standards in computer hardware and software development and communications infrastructure, changing and increasingly sophisticated customer needs and frequent new product introductions and enhancements characterize the industries in which we compete. -----

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: We are subject to a large number of city, county and state, domestic and international laws and regulations governing the provision of private security services. Relevant regulation for our operations and employees includes such matters as consumer protection, fair trade, jurisdiction-specific security industry regulation (including with respect to hardware requirements or operational requirements), data privacy, occupational health and safety, marketing and competition law. Additionally, most states in the United States have laws, or legislation pending, requiring qualification, training and registration of security officers, regulating the use of identification cards, badges and uniforms and imposing minimum bond surety or insurance standards. In order to install a security system, we generally must be licensed in the jurisdiction where we are installing the system. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to Our Business and Industries—Our business operates in a regulated industry, and noncompliance with regulations could materially restrict our operations and expose us to fines, penalties and other liabilities and negative consequences.” Additionally, we generally must obtain operating certificates or permits for our security systems, and provide specified levels of training to our employees at those centers. Our international operations are subject to risks that are different from those we face in the United States and subject us to complex and frequently changing laws and regulations, including differing labor laws and regulations relating to the protection of certain information that we collect and maintain about our employees, clients and other third parties. We operate under many complex and diverse regulatory frameworks, some of which have extraterritorial reach and many where regulations change frequently. Among these laws are the U.K. Modern Slavery Act, the U.K. Bribery Act, and the GDPR, which took effect in May 2018. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to Our Business and Industries—Our international business involves risks different from those we face in the United States that could have an effect on our results of operations and financial condition.”

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Allied Universal’s most material trademarks are “AU” and “ALLIED UNIVERSAL,” together with other variants containing the term “ALLIED.” G4S’s most material trademarks are “G4S” and “Securing Your World.” Neither Allied Universal nor G4S has had any significant difficulties registering any trademarks, nor are there any known limitations on the ownership or use of, or problems with respect to, the digital or online presence of, its respective key brands.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: On a pro forma basis after giving effect to the Transactions, we employ approximately 740,000 security professionals and operate in more than 225 locations in all 50 US states, the District of Columbia and Puerto Rico. As of the date of this offering circular, on a pro forma basis after giving effect to the Transactions, approximately 26% of our employees were unionized. We believe that our relationships with our employees are good, and we have not experienced any work stoppages as a result of labor disputes. With over 740,000 security professionals on a combined basis delivering critically important services across every continent, employee and customer safety is of paramount importance to us. We have a continuing focus on enhancing safety policies, standards and culture and our goal is zero harm. The nature of our work and the environments in which we operate mean that security and safety present an operational and strategic risk to our business and, from time to time, members of our workforce may be subject to injuries and fatalities. We believe that setting the highest standards for health and safety across our industry helps to keep our security professionals safe and builds employee loyalty and commitment to our combined company.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: We believe that we maintain all appropriate forms of insurance, including comprehensive general liability, performance and crime bonding, professional liability, automobile coverage and excess and umbrella coverage. Special coverage is sometimes added in response to unique customer requirements. We also maintain compliance with all state workers’ compensation laws. ----- We maintain insurance coverage, subject to certain self-insured retention limits, for workers’ compensation, general liability, employment practices liability and healthcare claims (under employee medical benefit plans). Medical benefit costs for the majority of our workforce are premium-based. Costs associated with the premium-based plans equal the actual premiums paid. Conversely, for administrative employees and select security officers’ medical coverages, we are self-insured and subject to self-insured retention limits.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Allied Universal’s corporate office is located at 1551 North Tustin Avenue, Suite 650, Santa Ana, CA 92705. G4S’s corporate office is located at 5th Floor, Southside, 105 Victoria Street, London, SW1E 6QT. On a pro forma basis after giving effect to the Transactions, we operate nationwide in the United States with services throughout the 50 states, as well as in over 90 countries globally. All of our facilities are leased and none are owned. We believe that if we were unable to renew the lease on any of these facilities, we would be able to lease other suitable facilities on commercially reasonable terms. We do not believe that any individual facility or lease is material to our business.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: We are and, from time to time, may become party to regulatory proceedings or to litigation or subject to nonlitigated claims arising out of the normal operations of our businesses such as general liability and employment claims. We cannot predict the timing or outcome of these claims and proceedings. For a description of certain ongoing and past litigations, see “Risk Factors—Risk Related to Our Business—We are subject to risks from litigation or legal proceedings, as well as tax audits, which could adversely affect our financial results and condition.” Under the laws of many of the jurisdictions in which we operate, we may be held liable for the negligent acts or misconduct of our agents or employees performed while on duty and in the course and scope of their employment. We experience a significant volume of claims and litigation in the ordinary course of business asserting that we are liable for damages as a result of the conduct of our employees or others. From time to time individuals bring personal injury lawsuits against us seeking substantial damages based on alleged negligence or other theories of liability in our provision of security services, including with respect to injuries not directly caused by, or within the control of, our security officers. Under principles of common law, we generally can be held liable for wrongful acts or omissions to act of our agents or employees during the course, and within the scope, of their agency or employment with us. In addition, many of our customer contracts contain provisions whereby we are contractually obligated to defend, indemnify and hold harmless our clients. These provisions vary from indemnification for our own negligence and misconduct to providing indemnification for any claims related to our services regardless of our fault. In a limited number of situations, we may also be contractually required to indemnify our customers in cases of their own contributory negligence. We are also subject to a significant number of wage and hour class actions and multi-plaintiff lawsuits, singleemployee lawsuits, Private Attorneys General Act claims and attorney demands, in addition to wage and hour governmental audits. We maintain insurance coverage, subject to certain self-insured retention limits, for workers’ compensation, general liability, employment practices liability and healthcare claims (under employee medical benefit plans), which we believe adequately insure us. We also seek to mitigate this risk exposure through indemnification or liability limitations in our contracts, analysis of customer facilities and implementation of programs for employee screening, training, supervision and safety and anonymous reporting by our employees. We believe that we have established adequate reserves for litigation liabilities in our consolidated financial statements.
