Currently, we are involved in certain legal and governmental matters, such as the DPA that G4S entered into with the SFO in respect of the UK Care & Justice electronic monitoring contract investigation, inquiries that G4S received from the BCA and DoJ in connection with G4S’s Belgian business, class action litigation relating to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, claims under the Anti-Terrorism Act relating to alleged support provided by G4S to the Taliban ----- in Afghanistan and certain claims in India relating to the India Provident Fund, as further described under “Risk Factors—Risks Related to Our Business and Industries—The nature of our business exposes us to significant risks related to legal proceedings, claims, governmental inquiries and investigations, and negative press and media investigations that could have a material adverse effect on our reputation, business, and results of operations,” “Risk Factors—Risks Related to Our Business and Industries—We are subject to risks from litigation or legal proceedings, as well as tax audits, which could adversely affect our financial results and condition” and “Risk Factors—Risks Related to Our Business and Industries—The security services we provide may subject us to liability for substantial damages not covered by insurance.” We currently do not expect any of these matters nor any other legal or governmental matters we are involved in to have a material adverse effect on our combined business, financial condition, results of operations or cash flows, but we can provide no assurance on the future developments or outcomes of any such arbitrations and/or legal proceedings discussed in this offering circular, including the G4S matters discussed above. Exposure to litigation is inherent in our ongoing business and may materially harm our combined business, financial condition, results of operations or cash flows in the future.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: On the issue date of the notes offered hereby, we expect that the notes will be guaranteed by the following entities: Atlas LuxCo 4 S. à r.l. (for the unsecured notes only); Atlas LuxCo 1 S.à r.l.; Atlas LuxCo 2 S.à r.l.; Atlas LuxCo 3 S.à r.l.; Atlas LuxCo 5 S.à r.l.; Atlas Luxembourg 3 SCSp; Atlas UK Intermediate Limited; Atlas UK Parent Limited; Atlas UK-EUR Limited; Atlas UK-USD Limited; Atlas UK Bidco Limited; AlliedBarton Security Services LLC; AlliedBarton (NC) LLC; Allied Security Holdings LLC; Allied Universal Executive Protection and Intelligence Services, Inc., f/k/a AS Solution North America, Inc.; Allied Universal Risk Advisory and Consulting Services, Inc., f/k/a Andrews International Government Services Inc.; American Security Programs, Inc.; Apollo Security International, Inc. Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: _The following discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations are based upon financial statements which have been prepared in accordance with GAAP, and should be read together with the applicable consolidated financial statements, the notes to those financial statements and the other financial information appearing elsewhere in this offering circular. Unless otherwise specified, this “Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations” relates only to the historical results of Allied Universal and its subsidiaries, and does not give effect to the Transactions. Capitalized terms used in this section shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section unless the context provides otherwise._

Subsubsection Title: Steve Jones has served as our Chief Executive Officer since August 2016. From 2007 to August 2016,
Subsubsection Text: Mr. Jones served as the Chief Executive Officer of Universal Services of America, Inc., which merged with AlliedBarton in 2016 to create Allied Universal. Prior thereto, Mr. Jones served in various positions at Universal Protection Service, Inc., a subsidiary of Universal Services of America, including as Co-Chief Executive Officer and Chief Operating Officer from 1996 until 2007.

Subsubsection Title: Tim Brandt has served as our Chief Financial Officer since March 2021. Mr. Brandt previously was with
Subsubsection Text: Deloitte & Touche for approximately 30 years, most recently as Managing Partner of its Orange County, California, office.

Subsubsection Title: Andy Sause has served as our Chief Administration Officer since May 2017. Prior thereto, Mr. Sause served
Subsubsection Text: as a Principal in the Corporate Development practice area at the Boston Consulting Group from 2010 to 2017. Prior to the Boston Consulting Group he served as a nuclear submarine officer in the US Navy and attended the Stanford Graduate School of Business. He holds engineering degrees from the US Naval Academy and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

Subsubsection Title: Michael Beregovsky has served as our Chief Mergers & Acquisitions Officer and Co-Head of Strategy and
Subsubsection Text: Investor Relations since April 2021. Prior thereto, Mr. Beregovsky served as a member of the Allied Universal Board of Directors and as an investment professional at Warburg Pincus in New York and London. Prior to Warburg Pincus, Mr. Beregovsky worked at Thomas H. Lee Partners and at Banc of America Securities. He received a B.S. in Mathematics from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and an MBA from the Harvard Business School.

Subsubsection Title: David Buckman has served as our Executive Vice President and General Counsel since August 2016. From
Subsubsection Text: April 2005 through August 2016, Mr. Buckman served as the Executive Vice President and General Counsel of AlliedBarton. Mr. Buckman previously served as Associate General Counsel of Aramark, a leading provider of food and support services and as an attorney with Morgan Lewis, an international law firm. He holds a B.A. from Amherst College and a J.D. from the University of Pennsylvania Law School. -----

Subsection Title: CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS Governing Documents
Subsubsection Text: The Investor Group (or funds or vehicles affiliated with the Investor Group), certain co-investors of the Investor Group and certain other parties are parties the Second Amended and Restated Limited Liability Company Agreement of Topco. This agreement contains agreements among the parties with respect to, among other things, restrictions on the transfer of interests, voting rights, registration rights, certain expense reimbursement and customary indemnification provisions.

We are party to an Investor Management Agreement with certain funds and vehicles affiliated with Warburg Pincus pursuant to which Warburg Pincus provides us with certain assistance and support services. Per the terms of this agreement, we are responsible for paying Warburg Pincus an annual fee based on the type and quantity of services provided. The Investor Management Agreement also includes certain expense reimbursement and indemnification provisions.
From time to time, we and our affiliates may also enter into employment or compensations with senior management or other key employees. -----
The names, ages and positions of Allied Universal’s executive officers as of the date of this offering circular are listed in the table below.

On April 8, 2021, in connection with the completion of the G4S Acquisition, the Company entered into the New Senior Secured Credit Facilities, consisting of the New First Lien USD Term Facility, the New First Lien Euro Term Facility and the New Revolving Credit Facility with Credit Suisse AG, Cayman Islands Branch as administrative agent and collateral agent and the lenders and financial institutions party thereto from time to time. The following is a summary description of certain terms of the New Senior Secured Credit Facilities. The New Senior Secured Credit Facilities are comprised of (i) the New First Lien USD Term Facility in an aggregate principal amount of $950 million, (ii) the New First Lien Euro Term Facility in an aggregate principal amount of €715.5 million and (iii) the New Revolving Credit Facility in an aggregate principal amount of €300 million.

The New USD Term Facility and the New Euro Term Facility incurred under the New Senior Secured Credit Facilities will mature on April 8, 2028. The New Revolving Credit Facility incurred under the New Senior Secured Credit Facilities will mature on April 8, 2026. Subject to certain exceptions, the New First Lien Term Loan Facilities will be subject to mandatory prepayments, including in amounts equal to: - 100% of the net cash proceeds from issuances or the incurrence of debt by the Company or any of its subsidiary guarantors (other than certain indebtedness permitted by the New First Lien Term Loan Facilities and the New Revolving Credit Facility); - 100% of the net cash proceeds from certain sales or other dispositions of assets (including as a result of casualty or condemnation) by the Company or any of the subsidiary guarantors in excess of a certain amount and subject to customary reinvestment provisions and certain other exceptions; and - 50% (with stepdowns to 25% and 0% based upon achievement of specified first lien net leverage ratios) of annual excess cash flow of the Company and its subsidiaries, subject to customary exceptions and limitations. The Existing First Lien Term Loan Facility and the Existing Delayed Draw Term Loan Facility mature on July 12, 2026. The Revolving Credit Facility and the ABL Credit Facility mature on July 12, 2024. Subject to certain exceptions, the Existing First Lien Term Loan Facility is subject to mandatory prepayments, including in amounts equal to: - 100% of the net cash proceeds from issuances or the incurrence of debt by the Company or any of its subsidiary guarantors (other than certain indebtedness permitted by the Existing First Lien Term Loan Facility and the Existing Revolving Credit Facility); - 100% of the net cash proceeds from certain sales or other dispositions of assets (including as a result of casualty or condemnation) by the Company or any of the subsidiary guarantors in excess of a certain amount and subject to customary reinvestment provisions and certain other exceptions; and - 50% (with stepdowns to 25% and 0% based upon achievement of specified first lien net leverage ratios) of annual excess cash flow of the Company and its subsidiaries, subject to customary exceptions and limitations.

The obligations of the Company under the New Senior Secured Credit Facilities are guaranteed by certain of our material wholly owned restricted subsidiaries, subject to customary exceptions and limitations (including agreed security principles). The New Senior Secured Credit Facilities are also guaranteed by a parent of the Company. The New First Lien Term Loan Facilities and the New Revolving Credit Facility are secured by a first priority lien on the Term Priority Collateral and a second priority lien on the ABL Collateral (each as defined in the credit agreement governing the New Senior Secured Credit Facilities), in each case, secured ratably on a pari passu basis with the secured notes and related guarantees. ----- The obligations of the Company under the Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities are guaranteed by certain of our material wholly owned restricted subsidiaries, subject to customary exceptions and limitations. The Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities are also guaranteed by a parent of the Company. ----- The ABL Credit Facility is secured by a first priority lien over substantially all of the Company’s and each guarantor’s cash and cash equivalents, accounts receivable, inventory and other current and related assets, subject to certain exceptions (the “ABL Collateral”) and a second priority lien over substantially all of the Company’s and each guarantor’s other assets, subject to certain exceptions (the “Term Priority Collateral”). The Existing First Lien Term Loan Facility and the Existing Revolving Credit Facility are secured by a first priority lien on the Term Priority Collateral and a second priority lien on the ABL Collateral, in each case, secured ratably on a pari passu basis with the notes and related guarantees. The obligations of the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer under the Existing 2026 Secured Notes are guaranteed, jointly and severally, by each of the Allied issuer’s and the Allied co-issuer’s existing and future whollyowned domestic restricted subsidiaries that guarantee the New Senior Secured Credit Facilities and the Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities or that guarantee certain capital markets debt securities of the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer or any guarantor (subject to certain exceptions). ----- The Existing 2026 Secured Notes and related guarantees are secured on a first lien basis by substantially all assets of the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer and the guarantors (other than any Excluded Assets or ABL Collateral), which assets also secure the Allied issuer’s and the Allied co-issuer’s and the guarantors’ obligations under the Existing First Lien Term Loan Facility, the Existing Delayed Draw Term Loan Facility, the Existing Revolving Credit Facility, the New Senior Secured Credit Facilities and the secured notes offered hereby ratably on a pari passu basis, subject to permitted liens. The Existing 2026 Secured Notes and related guarantees are also secured on a second-lien basis ratably on a pari passu basis with the Existing First Lien Term Loan Facility, the Existing Delayed Draw Term Loan Facility, the Existing Revolving Credit Facility, the New Senior Secured Credit Facilities and the secured notes offered hereby, subject to permitted liens, by the ABL Collateral.

The interest rate per annum applicable to loans issued under the New First Lien Term Loan Facility and the New Revolving Credit Facility is based, at the Company’s election, on a fluctuating rate of interest determined by reference to either (i) a base rate determined by reference to the higher of (a) the U.S. prime rate as quoted by The Wall Street Journal, (b) the federal funds effective rate plus 0.5% and (c) (x) the London Interbank Offered Rate (“LIBOR”) applicable for an interest period of one month, plus (y) 1.00% per annum, in each case, plus an applicable margin or (ii) an adjusted LIBOR (or Euro Interbank Offered Rate (“EURIBOR”) based on currency) rate determined by reference to the higher of (a) LIBOR (or EURIBOR) or SONIA (or as otherwise determined pursuant to the New Senior Secured Credit Facilities) and (b) 0%, plus an applicable margin. The interest rate per annum applicable to loans issued under the Existing First Lien Term Loan Facility and the Existing Revolving Credit Facility is based, at the Company’s election, on a fluctuating rate of interest determined by reference to either (i) a base rate determined by reference to the higher of (a) the U.S. prime rate as quoted by The Wall Street Journal, (b) the federal funds effective rate plus 0.5% and (c) (x) the LIBOR applicable for an interest period of one month, plus (y) 1.00% per annum, in each case, plus an applicable margin or (ii) an adjusted LIBOR rate determined by reference to the higher of (a) LIBOR and (b) 0%, plus an applicable margin. The interest rate per annum applicable to loans issued under the ABL Credit Facility is based on a fluctuating rate of interest determined by reference to either (i) a base rate determined by reference to the higher of (a) the U.S. prime rate as quoted by The Wall Street Journal, (b) the federal funds effective rate plus 0.5% and (c) (x) the LIBOR rate applicable for an interest period of one month, plus (y) 1.00% per annum, in each case, plus an applicable margin or (ii) an adjusted LIBOR rate determined by reference to the higher of (a) LIBOR and (b) 0%, in each case, plus an applicable margin.

We will pay certain recurring fees with respect to the New Senior Secured Credit Facilities and will continue to do so, including, (i) fees on the unused commitments of the lenders under the New Revolving Credit Facility, (ii) letter of credit fees on the aggregate face amounts of outstanding letters of credit plus a fronting fee to the issuing bank and (iii) administration fees. We pay certain recurring fees with respect to the Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities and will continue to do so, including, (i) fees on the unused commitments of the lenders under the ABL Credit Facility and the Existing Revolving Credit Facility, (ii) letter of credit fees on the aggregate face amounts of outstanding letters of credit plus a fronting fee to the issuing bank and (iii) administration fees.

The New Senior Secured Credit Facilities contain a number of customary affirmative and negative covenants that, among other things, limit or restrict the ability of the Company and the guarantors to: - incur additional indebtedness (including guarantee obligations); - incur liens; - engage in mergers or other fundamental changes; - sell certain property or assets; - pay dividends or other distributions; - make acquisitions, investments, loans and advances; - prepay certain indebtedness; - change the nature of their business; - engage in certain transactions with affiliates; and - incur restrictions on contractual obligations limiting interactions between the Company and its subsidiaries or limit actions in relation to the New Senior Secured Credit Facilities. The New Revolving Credit Facility contains a springing financial covenant that requires the Company, solely to the extent outstanding loans under the New Revolving Credit Facility on the last day of the Company’s fiscal quarter exceed a certain threshold, to comply with a maximum first lien net leverage ratio of 7.75 to 1.00. Under the New First Lien Term Loan Facilities and the New Revolving Credit Facility, consolidated EBITDA includes additional add-backs to net income for certain costs, fees, taxes, losses, charges, write-offs, write-downs and expenses. The Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities contain a number of customary affirmative and negative covenants that, among other things, limit or restrict the ability of the Company and the guarantors to: - incur additional indebtedness (including guarantee obligations); - incur liens; - engage in mergers or other fundamental changes; - sell certain property or assets; - pay dividends or other distributions; - make acquisitions, investments, loans and advances; - prepay certain indebtedness; - change the nature of their business; - engage in certain transactions with affiliates; and - incur restrictions on contractual obligations limiting interactions between the Company and its subsidiaries or limit actions in relation to the Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities. ----- The Existing Revolving Credit Facility contains a springing financial covenant that requires the Company, solely to the extent outstanding loans under the Existing Revolving Credit Facility on the last day of the Company’s fiscal quarter exceed a certain threshold, to comply with a maximum first lien net leverage ratio of 7.75 to 1.00. Under the Existing First Lien Term Loan Facility and Existing Revolving Credit Facility, consolidated EBITDA includes additional add-backs to net income for certain costs, fees, taxes, losses, charges, write-offs, write-downs and expenses. In addition, the ABL Credit Facility contains a springing financial covenant that requires the Company, after failure to meet the minimum availability threshold, to comply with a minimum fixed charge coverage ratio (consolidated EBITDA less taxes and capital expenditures to Fixed Charges (as defined in the credit agreement governing the ABL Credit Facility)) of 1.00 to 1.00. Under the ABL Credit Facility, consolidated EBITDA includes additional add-backs to net income for certain costs, fees, taxes, losses, charges, write-offs, write-downs and expenses and Fixed Charges include cash interest expenses and scheduled principal payments in respect of indebtedness. The Existing Secured Indenture governing the Existing 2026 Secured Notes contains a number of customary covenants that, among other things, limit or restrict the ability of the issuer and its restricted subsidiaries, subject to certain exceptions, to: - incur or guarantee additional indebtedness or issue disqualified stock or preferred stock; - pay dividends and make other distributions on, or redeem or repurchase, capital stock; - make certain investments; - incur certain liens; - enter into transactions with affiliates; - merge or consolidate; - enter into agreements that restrict the ability of restricted subsidiaries to make dividends or other payments to the issuer, the existing co-issuer or the guarantors; - designate restricted subsidiaries as unrestricted subsidiaries; and ----- - transfer or sell assets. Certain of these covenants will not apply to the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer and their restricted subsidiaries during any period in which the Existing 2026 Secured Notes are rated investment grade by two of Fitch Ratings, Inc., Moody’s Investors Service, Inc. and Standard & Poor’s Ratings Services. The Existing Unsecured Indenture governing the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes contains a number of customary covenants that, among other things, limit or restrict the ability of the issuer, the existing co-issuer and the restricted subsidiaries, subject to certain exceptions, to: - incur or guarantee additional indebtedness or issue disqualified stock or preferred stock; - pay dividends and make other distributions on, or redeem or repurchase, capital stock; - make certain investments; - incur certain liens; - enter into transactions with affiliates; - merge or consolidate; - enter into agreements that restrict the ability of restricted subsidiaries to make dividends or other payments to the issuer, the existing co-issuer or the guarantors; - designate restricted subsidiaries as unrestricted subsidiaries; and - transfer or sell assets. Certain of these covenants will not apply to the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer and their restricted subsidiaries during any period in which the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes are rated investment grade by two of Fitch Ratings, Inc., Moody’s Investors Service, Inc. and Standard & Poor’s Ratings Services. ----- The 2019 Note Purchase Agreement contains a leverage covenant, which is measured as at the twelve-month period ended on June 30 and 31 December each year (each, a “Relevant Period”). The leverage covenant requires that G4S not permit the ratio of consolidated net indebtedness as of the last day of any Relevant Period to consolidated EBITDA for such Relevant Period to exceed 3.5 to 1.0. In addition, the 2019 Note Purchase Agreement also contains a number of customary covenants for private placement notes that, among other things, limit or restrict the ability of G4S Finance, G4S and any subsidiary guarantor, as applicable, subject to certain exceptions, to: - incur or guarantee additional indebtedness; - incur certain liens; - enter into transactions with affiliates; - merge or consolidate; and - transfer or sell assets. The 2007 Note Purchase Agreement contains a leverage covenant, which is measured as at the applicable Relevant Period. The leverage covenant requires that G4S not permit the ratio of consolidated net indebtedness as of the last day of any Relevant Period to consolidated EBITDA for such Relevant Period to exceed 3.5 to 1.0. In addition, the 2007 Note Purchase Agreement also contains a number of customary covenants for private placement notes that, among other things, limit or restrict the ability of G4S and any subsidiary guarantor, as applicable, subject to certain exceptions, to: - incur or guarantee additional indebtedness; - incur certain liens; - enter into transactions with affiliates; - merge or consolidate; and - transfer or sell assets.

The New Senior Secured Credit Facilities contain customary events of default, including with respect to nonpayment of principal, interest, fees or other amounts; material inaccuracy of a representation or warranty; failure ----- to perform or observe covenants; bankruptcy and insolvency events; monetary judgment defaults; actual or asserted invalidity or impairment of any material definitive loan documentation; and a change of control. The Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities contain customary events of default, including with respect to nonpayment of principal, interest, fees or other amounts; material inaccuracy of a representation or warranty; failure to perform or observe covenants; bankruptcy and insolvency events; monetary judgment defaults; actual or asserted invalidity or impairment of any material definitive loan documentation; and a change of control. The Existing Secured Indenture provides for events of default (subject in certain cases to customary grace and cure periods), which include, among others, nonpayment of principal or interest when due, breach of covenants or other agreements in the Existing Secured Indenture, defaults in payment of certain other indebtedness and certain events of bankruptcy or insolvency. Generally, if an event of default occurs, the Trustee or the holders of at least 30% in principal amount of the outstanding Existing 2026 Secured Notes may declare the principal of and unpaid interest on all of the Existing 2026 Secured Notes to be due and payable immediately. The Existing Unsecured Indenture provides for events of default (subject in certain cases to customary grace and cure periods), which include, among others, nonpayment of principal or interest when due, breach of covenants or other agreements in the Existing Unsecured Indenture, defaults in payment of certain other indebtedness and certain events of bankruptcy or insolvency. Generally, if an event of default occurs, the 2027 Unsecured Notes Trustee or the holders of at least 30% in principal amount of the outstanding Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes may declare the principal of and unpaid interest on all of the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes to be due and payable immediately. The terms and conditions of the G4S Notes contain certain events of default (subject in certain cases to customary grace and cure periods or certain other exceptions), which include, among others, non-payment of principal or interest when due, failure to perform any obligations under the terms and conditions relating to the G4S Notes or the trust deed relating to the G4S Notes, defaults in payment of certain other indebtedness for borrowed money, and certain events of liquidation or insolvency. If an event of default occurs, the trustee relating to the G4S Notes may, and if requested in writing by holders of at least one-fifth in nominal amount of the G4S Notes or if so directed by an Extraordinary Resolution shall (subject to certain requirements), give notice to G4S and G4S Finance that the G4S Notes shall become due and payable at their principal amount together with accrued interest as provided in the G4S Trust Deed. ----- The 2019 Note Purchase Agreement provides for events of default (subject in certain cases to customary grace and cure periods), which include, among others, nonpayment of principal, interest or other premium when due, breach of covenants or other agreements in the 2019 Note Purchase Agreement, defaults in payment of certain other indebtedness and certain events of bankruptcy or insolvency. Generally, if event of default occurs, holders of more than 50% of the aggregate principal amount of 2019 Private Placement Senior Notes (without regard to series) outstanding (exclusive of notes then owned by G4S Finance, G4S or any of their respective affiliates) may declare all principal, accrued and unpaid interest and make-whole amount in respect of the 2019 Private Placement Senior Notes to be immediately due and payable; however, if a non-payment event of default occurs, any holder or holders of 2019 ----- Private Placement Senior Notes may declare all principal, accrued and unpaid interest and make-whole amount in respect of such 2019 Private Placement Senior Notes held by it or them to be immediately due and payable. The 2007 Note Purchase Agreement provides for events of default (subject in certain cases to customary grace and cure periods), which include, among others, nonpayment of principal, interest or other premium when due, breach of covenants or other agreements in the 2007 Note Purchase Agreement, defaults in payment of certain other indebtedness and certain events of bankruptcy or insolvency. Generally, if event of default occurs, holders of at least 51% of the aggregate principal amount of 2007 Private Placement Senior Notes outstanding (without regard to series and exclusive of notes then owned by G4S or any of its affiliates) may declare all principal, accrued and unpaid interest and make-whole amount in respect of the 2007 Private Placement Senior Notes to be immediately due and payable; however, if a non-payment event of default occurs, any holder or holders of 2007 Private Placement Senior Notes may declare all principal, accrued and unpaid interest and make-whole amount in respect of such 2007 Private Placement Senior Notes held by it or them to be immediately due and payable. The CP Notes do not contain any events of default.

On July 12, 2019, in connection with the Refinancing, the Company entered into the Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities, consisting of the Existing First Lien Term Loan Facility, the Existing Delayed Draw Term Loan Facility and the Existing Revolving Credit Facility with Credit Suisse AG, Cayman Islands Branch as administrative agent and collateral agent, and the lenders and financial institutions party thereto from time to time, and the ABL Credit Facility, with Citibank, N.A. as administrative agent and collateral agent, and the lenders and financial institutions party thereto from time to time. The following is a summary description of certain terms of the Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities. The Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities are comprised of (i) the Existing First Lien Term Loan Facility in an aggregate principal amount of $2,198 million, (ii) the Existing Revolving Credit Facility in an aggregate principal amount of $300 million, all of which was undrawn as of the date of this offering circular and (iii) the ABL Credit Facility having an initial commitment of up to $1,500.0 million (subject to a borrowing base), all of which was undrawn as of the date of this offering circular (after giving effect to the ABL Credit Facility Increase and excluding approximately $275.0 million of letters of credit expected to be outstanding under the ABL Credit Facility). The proceeds from the Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities, collectively with the proceeds from the Existing 2026 Secured Notes and the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes, were used to consummate the Refinancing, cash collateralize, replace or provide credit support for certain existing letters of credit outstanding and provide working capital and funds for other general corporate purposes (and certain fees and expenses related thereto). The proceeds from the Existing Delayed Draw Term Loan Facility were used to finance a portion of the consideration relating to the SOS Security Acquisition. During March 2020, the Company borrowed $500.0 million under the ABL Credit Facility in order to preserve financial flexibility and maintain liquidity in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. After not using any of the additional cash provided by this borrowing, the Company repaid the $500.0 million in full during August 2020.

On July 12, 2019, in connection with the Refinancing, the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer completed the sale of $1,000.0 million aggregate principal amount of the Existing 2026 Secured Notes. The terms of the Existing 2026 Secured Notes are governed by the Existing Secured Indenture. The proceeds from the Existing 2026 Secured Notes, together with the proceeds from the Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities and the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes, were used to consummate the Refinancing, cash collateralize, replace or provide credit support for certain existing letters of credit outstanding and provide working capital and funds for other general corporate purposes (and certain fees and expenses related thereto). On February 3, 2020, the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer completed the sale of an additional $540.0 million aggregate principal amount of the Existing 2026 Secured Notes under the Existing Secured Indenture. The net proceeds were used to (i) repay in full borrowings under the ABL Credit Facility and (ii) pay related fees and expenses. The Existing 2026 Secured Notes were issued and sold in a private transaction exempt from the registration requirements of the Securities Act, to persons reasonably believed to be qualified institutional buyers in accordance with Rule 144A under the Securities Act and to non-U.S. persons outside of the United States pursuant to Regulation S under the Securities Act. Accordingly, the Existing 2026 Secured Notes and the related guarantees are not registered under the Securities Act and the Existing 2026 Secured Notes and the related guarantees may not be offered or sold in the United States absent registration or an applicable exemption from the registration requirements of the Securities Act. On July 9, 2020, the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer completed the sale of an additional $400.0 million aggregate principal amount of the Existing 2026 Secured Notes under the Existing Secured Indenture. The net proceeds were used for general corporate purposes and to pay fees and expenses related to the offering.

The Existing 2026 Secured Notes are senior secured obligations and the Existing 2026 Secured Notes and the related guarantees rank equally in right of payment with all of the Allied issuer’s and the Allied co-issuer’s and guarantors’ existing and future senior indebtedness, including the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes, the Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities, the New Senior Secured Credit Facilities and the notes offered hereby, and senior in right of payment to any future subordinated indebtedness, and are effectively senior to any of the Allied issuer’s and the Allied co-issuer’s and guarantors’ existing and future unsecured indebtedness, including the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes and the unsecured notes offered hereby, and junior lien indebtedness to the extent of the value of the assets securing the notes, pari passu with all of the issuer’s, the existing co-issuer’s and each guarantor’s existing and future obligations secured on a first-lien basis (other than the obligations secured on a first-lien basis on the Excluded Assets and the ABL Collateral) and effectively junior to all of the issuer’s, the existing co-issuer’s and each guarantor’s existing and future obligations secured on a first-lien basis on the Excluded Assets or the ABL Collateral, including obligations under the ABL Credit Facility to the extent of the value of such assets. In addition, the Existing 2026 Secured Notes and related guarantees are structurally subordinated to the existing and future indebtedness, claims of holders of preferred stock and other liabilities of any subsidiary of the issuer that is not a guarantor of the Existing 2026 Secured Notes. The Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes are senior unsecured obligations and the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes and the related guarantees rank equally in right of payment with any existing and future senior indebtedness, including the Existing 2026 Secured Notes, the Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities, the New Senior Secured Credit Facilities and the notes offered hereby, and senior in right of payment to any future subordinated indebtedness, and are effectively subordinated to any existing and future secured indebtedness of the issuer, the existing co-issuer and the guarantors, including the Existing 2026 Secured Notes, the Senior Secured Credit Facilities, the New Senior Secured Credit Facilities and the secured notes offered hereby to the extent of the value of the asset securing such indebtedness. In addition, the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes and the guarantees are structurally subordinated to the existing and future indebtedness, claims of holders of preferred stock and other liabilities of any subsidiary of the issuer that is not a guarantor of the notes. The G4S Notes constitute direct, unconditional, unsubordinated and (subject to subject to the terms of the negative pledge as summarised below) unsecured obligations of G4S Finance and rank pari passu among themselves and (save for certain obligations required to be preferred by law) equally with all other unsecured obligations (other than any subordinated obligations) of G4S Finance from time to time outstanding. The 2019 Private Placement Senior Notes rank pari passu among themselves and (save for certain obligations required to be preferred by law) equally with all other unsecured obligations (other than any subordinated obligations) of G4S Finance from time to time outstanding. ----- The 2007 Private Placement Senior Notes rank pari passu among themselves and (save for certain obligations required to be preferred by law) equally with all other unsecured obligations (other than any subordinated obligations) of G4S from time to time outstanding. ----- The G4S Notes constitute a direct and unsecured obligation of G4S Finance ranking at least pari passu with all present and future unsecured and unsubordinated obligations of G4S Finance other than obligations mandatorily preferred by law applying to companies generally. The payment of the principal of, premium, if any, and interest on the Secured Notes and the payment of any Secured Note Guarantee will rank pari passu in right of payment to all existing and future Senior Indebtedness of the Issuer, the Co-Issuers or the relevant Guarantor, as the case may be, including the obligations of the Issuer, the Co-Issuers and such Guarantor under the Senior Credit Facilities, the Existing 2026 Secured Notes, the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes and the Unsecured Notes. The Secured Notes and the Secured Note Guarantees will be effectively senior in right of payment to all of the Issuer’s, the Co-Issuers’ and any Guarantor’s existing and future unsecured Indebtedness to the extent of the value of the assets securing the Secured Notes. As of December 31, 2020, on a pro forma basis after giving effect to the Transactions, the Issuers and the Guarantors would have had Secured Indebtedness of approximately $9,120.0 million outstanding (excluding capitalized leases), including borrowings and the related guarantees under the Senior Credit Facilities, the Existing 2026 Secured Notes and the Secured Notes with $300.0 million and €300.0 million available for borrowing under the revolving credit facilities under the Credit Agreements and $1,500.0 million available for borrowing under the ABL Credit Facility, without giving effect to approximately $275.0 million of outstanding letters of credit at December 31, 2020, which, if drawn, would be Secured Indebtedness. Although the Secured Indenture will contain limitations on the amount of additional Indebtedness that the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries may incur the amount of such additional Indebtedness could be substantial and, in any case, such Indebtedness may be Secured Indebtedness or Senior Indebtedness. See “—Certain Covenants— Limitation on Incurrence of Indebtedness and Issuance of Disqualified Stock and Preferred Stock.” The payment of the principal of, premium, if any, and interest on the Notes and the payment of any Note Guarantee will rank pari passu in right of payment to all existing and future Senior Indebtedness of the Issuer, the CoIssuer or the relevant Guarantor, as the case may be, including the obligations of the Issuer, the Co-Issuer and such Guarantor under the Senior Credit Facilities, the Existing 2026 Secured Notes, the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes and the Secured Notes. The Notes and the Note Guarantees will be effectively subordinated in right of payment to all of the Issuer’s, the Co-Issuer’s and any Guarantor’s existing and future Secured Indebtedness to the extent of the value of the assets securing such Secured Indebtedness. As of December 31, 2020, on a _pro forma_ basis after giving effect to the Transactions, the Issuers and the Guarantors would have had Secured Indebtedness of approximately $9,120.0 million outstanding (excluding capitalized leases), including borrowings and the related guarantees under the Senior Credit Facilities, the Existing 2026 Secured Notes and the Secured Notes with $300 million and €300.0 million available for borrowing under the revolving credit facilities under the Credit Agreements and $1,500.0 million available for borrowing under the ABL Credit Facility, without giving effect to approximately $275.0 million of outstanding letters of credit at December 31, 2020, which, if drawn, would be Secured Indebtedness. Although the Indenture will contain limitations on the amount of additional Indebtedness that the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries may incur the amount of such additional Indebtedness could be substantial and, in any case, such Indebtedness may be Secured Indebtedness or Senior Indebtedness. See “—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Incurrence of Indebtedness and Issuance of Disqualified Stock and Preferred Stock.”

The Existing 2026 Secured Notes bear interest at a rate of 6.625% per annum. Interest on the notes is payable semi-annually in cash in arrears on January 15 and July 15 of each year. The Existing 2026 Secured Notes mature on July 15, 2026. The Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes bear interest at a rate of 9.750% per annum. Interest on the notes is payable semi-annually in cash in arrears on January 15 and July 15 of each year. The Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes mature on July 15, 2027. The 2023 Notes bear interest at a rate of 1.5% per annum (subject to the coupon step up/step down described below). Interest on the 2023 Notes is payable annually in arrears on January 9 in each year. The 2023 Notes mature on January 9, 2023, unless previously redeemed, purchased and/or cancelled. The 2024 Notes bear interest at a rate of 1.5 % per annum (subject to the coupon step up/step down described below). Interest on the 2024 Notes is payable annually in arrears on June 2 in each year. The 2024 Notes mature on June 2, 2024, unless previously redeemed, purchased and/or cancelled. The 2025 Notes bear interest at a rate of 1.875% per annum (subject to the coupon step up/step down described below). Interest on the 2025 Notes is payable annually in arrears on May 24 in each year. The 2025 Notes mature on May 24, 2025, unless previously redeemed, purchased and/or cancelled. The terms and conditions of the G4S Notes contain a coupon step up/step down feature which is triggered if the credit rating of G4S falls to below investment grade. From the interest payment date following the date of such rating downgrade, a coupon step up margin of 1.25% per annum is payable on the G4S Notes. If the rating of G4S is reinstated to investment grade, the coupon step up margin will no longer be payable from the following interest payment date. The coupon step up margin is also payable if the G4S Notes are not assigned a rating for a period of 90 consecutive days. The 2019 Series A Notes bear interest at a rate of 4.90% per annum (subject to the coupon step up/step down described below). Interest on the 2019 Series A Notes is payable semi-annually in arrear on May 13 and November 13 each year. The 2019 Series A Notes mature on May 13, 2026, unless previously redeemed, purchased and/or cancelled. The 2019 Series B Notes bear interest at a rate of 5.12% per annum (subject to the coupon step up/step down described below). Interest on the 2019 Series B Notes is payable annually in arrear on May 13 and November 13 in each year. The 2019 Series B Notes mature on May 13, 2029, unless previously redeemed, purchased and/or cancelled. The 2019 Note Purchase Agreement contains a coupon step up/step down feature which is triggered (i) if the long term senior debt credit rating of G4S by an approved rating agency falls below investment grade, such that (a) there is one such rating and it is below investment grade, (b) there are two such ratings and one is below investment grade, (c) there are three such ratings and at least two are below investment grade or (ii) if G4S ceases to have a long term senior debt credit rating by an approved rating agency (each, a “Private Placement Notes Rating Event”). From the interest payment date following the date of such Private Placement Notes Rating Event, a coupon step up margin of 1.25% per annum is payable on the 2019 Private Placement Senior Notes. If the long term senior debt credit rating of G4S is reinstated to investment grade by an approved rating agency, such that (a) there is only one such rating and it is investment grade, (b) there are two such ratings and both are investment grade or (c) there are three such ratings and any two are investment grade, the coupon step up margin will no longer be payable from the following interest payment date. The 2007 Series D Notes bear interest at a rate of 6.06% per annum (subject to the coupon step up/step down described below). Interest on the 2007 Series D Notes is payable semi-annually in arrear on March 1 and September 1 each year. The 2007 Series D Notes mature on March 1, 2022, unless previously redeemed, purchased and/or cancelled. The 2007 Note Purchase Agreement contains a coupon step up/step down feature which is triggered by the occurrence of a Private Placement Notes Rating Event. From the interest payment date following the date of such Private Placement Notes Rating Event, a coupon step up margin of 1.25% per annum is payable on the 2007 Private Placement Senior Notes. If the long term senior debt credit rating of G4S is reinstated to investment grade by an approved rating agency, such that (a) there is only one such rating and it is investment grade, (b) there are two such ratings and both are investment grade or (c) there are three such ratings and any two are investment grade, the coupon step up margin will no longer be payable from the following interest payment date. The CP Notes were issued at a discount and do not bear interest. The CP Notes mature on May 14, 2021, unless previously redeemed.

Subsubsection Title: Issue of CP Notes under the CP Programme
Subsubsection Text: In May 2020, G4S Finance issued £300,000,000 in aggregate principal amount of commercial paper (the “CP Notes”). The CP Notes are guaranteed by G4S and are scheduled to mature on May 14, 2021. The CP Notes were issued under G4S and G4S Finance’s euro-commercial paper programme (the “CP Programme”). The CP Programme was established in May 2020 in order to borrow under the Bank of England’s Covid Corporate Financing Facility (the “CCFF”).

At any time prior to July 15, 2022, the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer may, at their option, redeem the Existing 2026 Secured Notes, in whole or in part, at a redemption price equal to 100% of their principal amount plus a make-whole premium, together with accrued and unpaid interest, if any, thereon to, but not including, the redemption date. From and after July 15, 2022, the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer may, at their option, redeem the Existing 2026 Secured Notes, in whole or in part, at the applicable redemption prices set forth in the Existing Secured Indenture, together with accrued and unpaid interest, if any, thereon to, but excluding, the redemption date. Prior to July 15, 2022, the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer may, at their option, redeem up to 40% of the aggregate principal amount of the Existing 2026 Secured Notes with an amount not to exceed the net cash proceeds from certain equity offerings at the applicable redemption prices specified set forth in the Existing Secured Indenture, together with accrued and unpaid interest, if any, thereon to, but excluding, the redemption date. If the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer experience certain change of control events, holders of the Existing 2026 Secured Notes may require the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer to repurchase all or part of the Existing 2026 Secured Notes at 101% of their principal amount, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, thereon to, but excluding, the repurchase date. At any time prior to July 15, 2022, the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer may, at their option, redeem the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes, in whole or in part, at a redemption price equal to 100% of their principal amount plus a make-whole premium, together with accrued and unpaid interest, if any, thereon to, but excluding, the redemption date. From and after July 15, 2022, the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer may, at their option, redeem the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes, in whole or in part, at the applicable redemption prices set forth in the Existing Unsecured Indenture, together with accrued and unpaid interest, if any, thereon to, but excluding, the redemption date. Prior to July 15, 2022, the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer may, at their option, redeem up to 40% of the aggregate principal amount of the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes with an amount not to exceed the net cash proceeds from certain equity offerings at the applicable redemption prices specified set forth in the Existing Unsecured Indenture, together with accrued and unpaid interest, if any, thereon to, but excluding, the redemption date. If the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer experience certain change of control events, holders of the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes may require the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer to repurchase all or part of the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes at 101% of their principal amount, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, thereon to, but excluding, the repurchase date. The terms and conditions of the G4S Notes provide certain early redemption options. The G4S Notes may be redeemed at the option of G4S Finance on the occurrence of certain tax events. The G4S Notes also allow a put right for holders upon the occurrence of a change of control put event. A change of control put event arises if (i) a change of control occurs, (ii) the credit rating of the G4S Notes falls to below investment grade or the rating of the G4S Notes is withdrawn as a result of the change of control, (iii) such ratings downgrade or withdrawal occurs before the end of 120 days from the date of the change of control (such 120 period being subject to extension as further described in the terms and conditions of the G4S Notes), and (iv) no reinstatement or replacement of the rating of the G4S Notes to investment grade occurs during this period. The G4S Notes are redeemable at their principal amount plus interest accrued to the date of redemption following early redemption for taxation reasons or a change of control put. G4S Finance, G4S and any of their respective subsidiaries may also purchase G4S Notes at any price in the open market or otherwise. G4S Finance may at its option retain any G4A Notes which have been redeemed or purchased for its own account and/or resell or cancel or otherwise deal with such G4S Notes at its discretion. The terms and conditions of the 2019 Private Placement Senior Notes provide certain early redemption options. The 2019 Private Placement Senior Notes may be redeemed at the option of G4S Finance, in an amount not less than 5% of the aggregate principal amount of such 2019 Private Placement Notes then outstanding in case of a partial prepayment, plus interest accrued to the date of redemption plus the make-whole amount, if any. The 2019 Note Purchase Agreement also requires G4S Finance to offer to prepay the entire unpaid principal amount of Notes held by each holder at 100% of the principal amount of such notes at par, plus interest accrued to the prepayment date, but without payment of the make-whole amount, upon the occurrence of a change of control. In addition, upon the occurrence of certain asset dispositions, if G4S Finance elects to apply the net proceeds of such asset disposition to repay or prepay outstanding unsubordinated indebtedness of G4S or any subsidiary of G4S, the 2019 Note Purchase Agreement also requires G4S Finance to make an offer to each holder to prepay at par (without payment of the makewhole amount but with payment of interest accrued to the prepayment date) a pro rata portion of the 2019 Private Placement Notes (without regard to series) held by such holder. The 2019 Private Placement Senior Notes also require G4S Finance to make an offer to prepay at par (and without payment of the make-whole amount but with payment of interest accrued to the prepayment date) the 2019 Private Placement Notes of affected holders upon the occurrence of certain sanctions events. The 2019 Private Placement Senior Notes may also be redeemed at the option of G4S Finance on the occurrence of certain tax events at 100% of the principal amount prepaid plus interest accrued to the prepayment date plus the modified-make whole amount. G4S and G4S Finance are also permitted to make an offer to purchase 2019 Private Placement Senior Notes pro rata to the holders of all 2019 Private Placement Senior Notes at the time outstanding upon the same terms and conditions (except to the extent necessary to reflect differences in the interest rates and maturities of different series of notes). The terms and conditions of the 2007 Private Placement Senior Notes provide certain early redemption options. The 2007 Private Placement Senior Notes may be redeemed at the option of G4S, in an amount not less than 5% of the aggregate principal amount of such 2019 Private Placement Notes then outstanding in case of a partial prepayment, plus interest accrued to the date of redemption plus the make-whole amount, if any. The 2019 Private Placement Senior Notes also require G4S Finance to offer to prepay the entire unpaid principal amount of Notes held ----- by each holder at 100% of the principal amount of such notes at par, plus interest accrued to the prepayment date, but without payment of the make-whole amount, upon the occurrence of a change of control. In addition, upon the occurrence of certain asset dispositions, if G4S elects to apply the net proceeds of such asset disposition to repay or prepay outstanding unsubordinated indebtedness of G4S or any subsidiary of G4S, the 2007 Note Purchase Agreement also requires G4S to make an offer to each holder to prepay at par (and without payment of the make-whole amount but with payment of interest accrued to the prepayment date) a pro rata portion of the 2007 Private Placement Notes (without regard to series) held by such holder. The 2007 Private Placement Senior Notes may also be redeemed at the option of G4S Finance on the occurrence of certain tax events at 100% of the principal amount prepaid plus interest accrued to the prepayment date plus the modified-make whole amount. G4S is also permitted to make an offer to purchase 2007 Private Placement Senior Notes pro rata to the holders of all 2007 Private Placement Senior Notes at the time outstanding upon the same terms and conditions (except to the extent necessary to reflect differences in the interest rates and maturities of different series of notes). Pursuant to the rules of the CCFF, G4S Finance may request the early redemption of the CP Notes. The acceptance of any such early redemption request by G4S Finance is at the discretion of the Bank of England and HM Treasury. -----

On July 12, 2019, in connection with the Refinancing, the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer completed the sale of $1,050.0 million aggregate principal amount of its Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes. The terms of the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes are governed by the Existing Unsecured Indenture. The proceeds from the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes, together with the proceeds from the Existing Senior Secured Credit Facilities and the Existing 2026 Secured Notes, were used to consummate the Refinancing, cash collateralize, replace or provide credit support for certain existing letters of credit outstanding and provide working capital and funds for other general corporate purposes (and certain fees and expenses related thereto). The Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes were issued and sold in a private transaction exempt from the registration requirements of the Securities Act, to persons reasonably believed to be qualified institutional buyers in accordance with Rule 144A under the Securities Act and to non-U.S. persons outside of the United States pursuant to Regulation S under the Securities Act. Accordingly, the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes and the related guarantees are not registered under the Securities Act and the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes and the related guarantees may not be offered or sold in the United States absent registration or an applicable exemption from the registration requirements of the Securities Act.

The obligations of the Allied issuer and the Allied co-issuer under the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes are guaranteed on a senior unsecured basis, jointly and severally, by each of the Allied issuer’s and the Allied co-issuer’s existing and future wholly-owned domestic restricted subsidiaries that guarantee the Existing Senior Secured Credit ----- Facilities or that guarantee certain capital markets debt securities of the issuer, the co-issuer or any guarantor (subject to certain exceptions). The payment of all sums expressed to be payable by G4S Finance in relation to the G4S Notes are unconditionally and irrevocably guaranteed by G4S under a trust deed relating to the relevant G4S Notes (the “G4S Trust Deed”). The obligations of G4S under the guarantees are direct, unconditional, unsubordinated and (subject to the terms of the negative pledge as summarised below) unsecured obligations of G4S and (save for certain obligations required to be preferred by law) rank equally with all other unsecured obligations (other than any subordinated obligations) of G4S from time to time outstanding. ----- The obligations of G4S Finance under the 2019 Note Purchase Agreement and in respect of the 2019 Private Placement Senior Notes are unconditionally and irrevocably guaranteed by G4S. The 2019 Note Purchase Agreement also permits, and, if any subsidiary acts as a borrower, issuer or guarantor under any Principal Bank Facility (as defined in the 2019 Note Purchase Agreement) or the 2007 Note Purchase Agreement requires, G4S Finance to obtain guarantees from such subsidiaries of its obligations under and in respect of the 2019 Note Purchase Agreement and the 2019 Private Placement Senior Notes. As of the date hereof, G4S Secure Solutions (USA) Inc. and G4S Holding One, Inc. are subsidiary guarantors and have entered into subsidiary guarantee agreements with respect to such subsidiary guarantees. The obligations of G4S and the subsidiary guarantors rank _pari passu_ in right of payment without preference or priority, with all unsecured and unsubordinated financial indebtedness of such guarantor. The 2007 Note Purchase Agreement permits, and, if any subsidiary acts as a borrower, issuer or guarantor under any Principal Bank Facility (as defined in the 2007 Note Purchase Agreement) or the 2019 Note Purchase Agreement requires, G4S to obtain guarantees from such subsidiaries of its obligations under and in respect of the 2007 Note Purchase Agreement and the 2007 Private Placement Senior Notes. As of the date hereof, G4S Secure Solutions (USA) Inc., G4S Holding One, Inc. and G4S Finance are subsidiary guarantors and have entered into subsidiary guarantee agreements with respect to such subsidiary guarantees. The obligations of the subsidiary guarantors rank pari passu in right of payment without preference or priority, with all unsecured and unsubordinated financial indebtedness of such subsidiary guarantor. The Guarantors, as primary obligors and not merely as sureties, will, jointly and severally, unconditionally Guarantee, on a secured senior basis, the full and punctual payment when due, whether at maturity, by acceleration or otherwise, of all obligations of the Issuers under the Secured Indenture and the Secured Notes, whether for payment of principal of, premium, if any, or interest or Additional Amounts on or in respect of the Secured Notes, expenses, indemnification or otherwise, on the terms set forth in the Secured Indenture by executing the Secured Indenture or a supplement thereto. From and after the Issue Date, the obligations of the Issuers under the Secured Notes and the Secured Indenture will be, jointly and severally, unconditionally Guaranteed on a secured senior basis (the “Secured Note _Guarantees”) by (i) each existing and future Wholly Owned Domestic Subsidiary that Guarantees the Issuer’s_ obligations under the Senior Credit Facilities and certain capital markets debt securities of the Issuer, the Co-Issuers or any Guarantor, subject to release as provided below or elsewhere in this “Description of Secured Notes” and (ii) each Issue Date Foreign Subsidiary Guarantor. In addition, certain U.S. and Foreign Subsidiaries of the Issuer incorporated in either Luxembourg or England and Wales will also provide a Secured Note Guarantee by entering into a supplemental indenture to the Secured Indenture, the Collateral Documents and joinders to the Intercreditor Agreements by the later of (i) 150 days after the Issue Date and (ii) the date on which such U.S. and Foreign Subsidiaries provide a guarantee under the Senior Credit Facilities. Following the Issue Date, Subsidiaries of the Issuer will be required to Guarantee the Secured Notes to the extent described in “—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Guarantees.” At its option, any Parent Entity may Guarantee the Secured Notes, but will not be subject to any of the covenants under the Secured Indenture. Each Secured Note Guarantee of a Guarantor will be: - a general secured senior obligation of such Guarantor; ----- - _pari passu in right of payment with any existing and future Senior Indebtedness (including Guarantees of the Senior Credit Facilities, the Existing 2026 Secured Notes, the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes and the Unsecured Notes) of such Guarantor; - secured on a first-priority basis by the Collateral owned by the Guarantors (other than Excluded Assets or ABL Collateral), which assets also secure the Guarantors’ obligations under the Credit Agreements and the Existing 2026 Secured Notes Indenture ratably on a pari passu basis, subject to certain Liens permitted under the Secured Indenture, and secured on a second-priority basis by the ABL Collateral that secures the ABL Credit Facility on a first-priority basis and the Credit Agreements and the Existing 2026 Secured Notes on a pari passu basis, subject to certain Liens permitted under the Secured Indenture; - effectively senior to any unsecured Indebtedness of such Guarantor to the extent of the value of the Collateral of such Guarantor securing the Secured Notes, including such Guarantor’s Guarantee of the Existing 2027 Unsecured Notes and the Unsecured Notes; - structurally subordinated to any existing and future Indebtedness, claims of holders of Preferred Stock and other liabilities of Non-Guarantor Subsidiaries; and - senior in right of payment to any future Subordinated Indebtedness of such Guarantor. Not all of the Issuer’s Subsidiaries will Guarantee the Secured Notes, and Secured Note Guarantees provided may be released in certain circumstances. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to Our Indebtedness and the Notes— Claims of holders of the notes offered hereby will be structurally subordinated to claims of creditors of certain of our subsidiaries that will not guarantee the notes offered hereby.” In the event of a bankruptcy, liquidation, reorganization or similar proceeding of any of these non-guarantor Subsidiaries, the non-guarantor Subsidiaries will pay the holders of their debt and their trade creditors before they will be able to distribute any of their assets to the Issuer, the Co-Issuers or a Guarantor, and claims of preferred and minority stockholders (if any) of those Subsidiaries and claims against joint ventures generally will have priority with respect to the assets and earnings of those Subsidiaries and joint ventures over the claims of creditors of the Issuers, including Holders. As a result, all of the existing and future liabilities of our Non-Guarantors, including any claims of trade creditors, will be structurally senior to the Secured Notes. Although the Secured Indenture will limit the incurrence of Indebtedness, Disqualified Stock and Preferred Stock of Restricted Subsidiaries, the limitation is subject to a number of significant exceptions. The Secured Indenture will not limit the amount of liabilities that are not considered Indebtedness that may be incurred by the Issuer or its Restricted Subsidiaries, including the Non-Guarantors. See “—Certain Covenants— Limitation on Incurrence of Indebtedness and Issuance of Disqualified Stock and Preferred Stock.” As of and for the year ended December 31, 2020, the Issuers and the Guarantors (exclusive of the Target and its consolidated Subsidiaries) represented approximately 95.6% of the Issuer’s total revenues, 85.0% of the Issuer’s total assets and 95.6% of the Issuer’s total liabilities, after excluding intercompany transactions and balances. In addition and subject to certain exceptions and the Agreed Security Principles, the Target and each of the Target’s material Subsidiaries incorporated in the United States, Luxembourg and England and Wales will guarantee the Secured Notes by the later of (i) 150 days after the Issue Date and (ii) the date on which such U.S. or Foreign Subsidiaries provide a Guarantee under the Senior Credit Facilities. As of and for the year ended December 31, 2020, Target entities organized in the United States, Luxembourg and England and Wales represented approximately 49.0% of the Target’s total revenues and 61.0% of the Target’s total assets. The obligations of each Guarantor under its Secured Note Guarantee will be limited as necessary to prevent the Secured Note Guarantee from constituting a fraudulent conveyance, fraudulent transfer or unjust preference under applicable law, including provisions of the United States Bankruptcy Code or any comparable provision of foreign or state law or provincial law to comply with corporate benefit, financial assistance and other laws. In addition, the Secured Note Guarantees provided by Guarantors that are Foreign Subsidiaries will be further limited as required under the Agreed Security Principles. Notwithstanding the foregoing and the provisions of the covenant described below under “—Certain Covenants—Liens,” in respect of guarantees or collateral provided by or over the assets of (or equity interests in) Foreign Subsidiaries, certain property, rights and assets may not be pledged, and any pledge over property, rights ----- and assets may be limited (or the Liens not perfected), in accordance with the Agreed Security Principles. The following is a non-exhaustive summary of certain terms of the Agreed Security Principles, which include, among others: (a) general legal and statutory limitations, regulatory restrictions, financial assistance, anti-trust and other competition authority restrictions, corporate benefit, fraudulent preference, equitable subordination, “transfer pricing,” “thin capitalisation,” “earnings stripping,” “controlled foreign _corporation” and other tax restrictions, “exchange control restrictions,” “capital maintenance” rules_ and “liquidity impairment” rules, tax restrictions, retention of title claims, employee consultation or approval requirements and similar principles; (b) the determination that the applicable time and cost (including adverse effects on taxes (including, in respect of the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries, their investors and/or their shareholders), interest deductibility, stamp duty, registration taxes, notarial costs guarantee fees payable to any Person that is not the Issuer or a Restricted Subsidiary and all applicable legal fees) would be disproportionate to the benefit accruing to the relevant secured parties of obtaining such guarantee or security; (c) the determination that, in respect of any guarantee or security which it is determined may be required to be discharged and/or released in connection with any corporate, tax structuring or other reorganization of the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries (an “Anticipated Reorganization”), the applicable time and cost (including adverse effects on taxes, interest deductibility, stamp duty, registration taxes, notarial costs guarantee fees payable to any person that is not the Issuer or a Restricted Subsidiary and all applicable legal fees) of taking, and then subsequently discharging and/or releasing such guarantee or security in connection with any Anticipated Reorganization, will not be disproportionate to the benefit accruing to the relevant secured parties of obtaining such guarantee or security; (d) subject to certain exceptions, that members of the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries in any jurisdiction outside of the United States of America (other than Atlas LuxCo 1 S.à r.l. or any whollyowned subsidiary of Atlas LuxCo 1 S.à r.l.) will not be required to give guarantees or enter into Security Documents if they are not a Wholly Owned Subsidiary or if it is not within the legal capacity of the relevant members of the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries or if it would conflict with the fiduciary or statutory duties of their directors or contravene any applicable legal, regulatory or contractual prohibition or restriction or have the potential to result in a material risk of personal or criminal liability for any director or officer of or for the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries; _provided that reasonable efforts (for a period of not more than 10 Business Days but without_ incurring material cost and without adverse impact on relationships with third parties) to overcome any such obstacle or otherwise such guarantee or security document shall be subject to such limit; (e) the agreement that guarantees and security will be limited so that the aggregate of notarial costs and all registration and like taxes and duties relating to the provision of security will not exceed an amount to be agreed between the Issuer and the Credit Agreement Collateral Agent in accordance with the terms of the corresponding Credit Agreements; (f) the agreement that where a class of assets to be secured includes material and immaterial assets, if the cost of granting security over the immaterial assets is disproportionate to the benefit of such security, security will be granted over the material assets only; (g) the agreement that it may be either impossible or impractical to create security over certain categories of assets in which event security will not be taken over such assets; (h) the exclusion from any guarantee or security of any asset subject to a legal requirement, contract, lease, licence, instrument, regulatory constraint (including any agreement with any government or regulatory body) or other third party arrangement, which may prevent or condition the asset from ----- being charged, secured or being subject to the applicable security document (including requiring a consent of any third party, supervisory board or works council (or equivalent)) and any asset which, if subject to the applicable security document, would give a third party the right to terminate or otherwise amend any rights, benefits and/or obligations with respect to the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries in respect of the asset or require the relevant chargor to take any action materially adverse to the interests of the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries or any member thereof; provided that reasonable efforts (for a period of not more than 20 Business Days but without incurring material cost) to obtain consent to charging any asset (where otherwise prohibited) shall be used by the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries if the asset is material and the Issuer is satisfied that such efforts will not involve placing relationships with third parties in jeopardy; (i) the agreement that the giving of a guarantee, the granting of security and the registration and/or the perfection of the security granted will not be required if it would have a material adverse effect on the ability of the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries to conduct their operations and business in the ordinary course as otherwise permitted by the Secured Notes Documents (including dealing with the secured assets and all contractual counterparties or amending, waiving or terminating (or allowing to lapse) any rights, benefits or obligations, in each case prior to an Event of Default which is continuing); (j) the agreement that any security document will only be required to be notarised if required by law in order for the relevant security to become effective or admissible in evidence; (k) the agreement that, on request, no guarantee or security will be required to be given (and no consent shall be required to be sought with respect thereto) by or over any acquired entity or business (excluding, for the avoidance of doubt, the Target and its Subsidiaries) which are required to guarantee, secure or otherwise credit support Indebtedness acquired in connection with an acquisition which is not prohibited by the Secured Notes Documents (or in each case (Refinancing Indebtedness in respect of such Indebtedness) (“Applicable Debt”) to the extent such indebtedness is permitted by the Secured Notes Documents to remain outstanding after an acquisition. No member of a target group or other entity acquired pursuant to an acquisition not prohibited by the Secured Notes Documents (or the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries making such acquisition) shall be required to become a guarantor or grant security with respect to any Secured Notes Documents if prevented by the terms of the documentation governing the Applicable Debt or if becoming a Guarantor or the granting of any security would give rise to an obligation (including any payment obligation) under or in relation thereto. No security or Lien in favour of the other Secured Parties will be granted or continue to subsist over any asset of the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries secured for the benefit of any Permitted Indebtedness (including Applicable Debt) and to the extent constituting a Lien permitted by the Secured Notes Documents; (l) the agreement that no title investigations or other diligence on assets will be required and no title insurance will be required; (m) the agreement that security will not be required over any assets subject to security in favor of a third party (other than in relation to security under general business conditions of account banks which do not prohibit or prevent the creation of security over such accounts) or any cash constituting regulatory capital or customer cash (and such assets or cash shall be excluded from any relevant security document); (n) the agreement that neither the Issuer nor any Restricted Subsidiary will be required to take any action in relation to any guarantees or security as a result of any assignment, sub-participation or transfer by any relevant secured party (and unless explicitly agreed to the contrary in the Secured Notes Documents the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries shall not bear or otherwise be liable for any taxes, any notarial registration or perfection fees or any other costs, fees or expenses that result from any assignment, sub-participation or transfer by any relevant secured party); ----- (o) the agreement that each security document shall be deemed not to restrict or condition any transaction not prohibited under the Secured Notes Documents and the security granted under each security document entered into after the Issue Date shall be deemed to be subject to these Agreed Security Principles, before and after the execution of the relevant security document and creation of the relevant security; (p) the agreement that no security may be provided on terms which are inconsistent with the turnover or sharing provisions (or any substantially equivalent provisions) in the Intercreditor Agreements; (q) the agreement that the Secured Parties (or any agent or similar representative appointed by them at the relevant time) will not be able to exercise any power of attorney or set-off granted to them under the terms of the Secured Notes Documents prior to the occurrence of an Event of Default which is continuing; (r) the agreement that no guarantee or security shall guarantee or secure any “Excluded Swap _Obligations” defined in accordance with the Loan Syndications and Trading Association’s (the_ “LSTA”) Market Advisory Update dated February 15, 2013 entitled “Swap Regulations' _Implications for Loan Documentation,” and any update thereto by the LSTA;_ (s) the agreement that other than a general security agreement and related filing, no perfection, filing or other action will be required with respect to assets of a type not owned by members of the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries; (t) the agreement that no fixed security will be required to be granted over real estate, intellectual property, letter of credit rights, tort claims (or the equivalent in any jurisdiction), insurance policies, aircraft, ships and vessels, motor vehicles, governmental contracts or governmental or regulatory licenses; (u) the agreement that no translation of any document relating to any security or any asset subject to any security will be required to be prepared or provided to the relevant secured party (or any agent or similar representative appointed by them at the relevant time) unless (i) required for such documents to become effective or admissible in evidence, and (ii) an Event of Default is continuing; and (w) the agreement that where the terms of a security document require a party thereto (other than any secured party) to use its “reasonable efforts,” “reasonable endeavours” or a similar or equivalent standard in taking an action thereunder, notwithstanding any meaning to the contrary as a matter of the governing law of such security document, such standards shall be interpreted and construed in accordance with the law of England and Wales and no Default or Event of Default (howsoever described) shall arise under any Secured Notes Documents in respect of a breach of such obligation because a contrary construction of such provision was taken (or would be taken by any applicable court of competent jurisdiction). By virtue of these limitations, a Guarantor’s obligation under its Secured Note Guarantee could be significantly less than amounts payable with respect to the Secured Notes, or a Guarantor may have effectively no obligation under its Secured Note Guarantee. If a Secured Note Guarantee were rendered voidable, it could be declared entirely void or subordinated by a court to all other indebtedness (including guarantees and other contingent liabilities) of the Guarantor, and, depending on the amount of such indebtedness, a Guarantor’s liability on its Secured Note Guarantee could be reduced to zero.
